description: The presidential election has concluded with a self-nominated candidate winning with a high turnout of 77.44%. The turnout is seen as an indicator of trust in regional authorities, with high turnout in regions where governors are viewed as acceptable and low turnout in regions where citizens are dissatisfied with their leaders.
original:
Post-election So, the elections of the head of state are completed, and the self-nominated candidate predictably won with a good result. The turnout also turned out to be unprecedentedly high - 77.44% of voters, a record in the Russian Federation.

What are the specifics of the electoral situation in the North?

In principle, it makes no sense to look at the distribution of votes between candidates - as one old advertisement said, “with all the wealth of choice, there is no other alternative.” But what makes sense to look at is the turnout. And here there is something to say.

It seems that turnout in these elections is a good indicator of trust in the authorities. But not the authorities in general, but primarily the regional authorities. Without the opportunity to directly influence the choice of governor, the population uses the elections as a kind of plebiscite, allowing the Center to understand that this or that governor is not coping with affairs. In this light, the turnout indicator can be considered as a weighted average of overall satisfaction with life, trust in the regional leadership and, finally, the actual desire to participate in the elections and vote for one of the candidates.

Colleagues have prepared a table with data on turnout in the Russian Arctic + (AZRF and Khanty-Mansi Autonomous Okrug). What do we see?

Turnout is high primarily in those regions where governors work in one way or another acceptable from the point of view of the mass citizen. At the same time, in two regions (ChAO and Krasnoyarsk Territory) the governors are relatively new and “positive expectation coefficients” can still be applied to them.

But in three regions - the Arkhangelsk region, Karelia and Komi - the situation is worse. In the latter, the turnout did not reach 60%. And this cannot be a mere coincidence: citizens show that regional leaders have overstayed their welcome and/or are not competent enough to continue to occupy their positions.

One more thing. It must be said that the situation itself, when you can “reach out” to the Center only by boycotting the presidential elections that happen once every seven years, is not healthy. It is necessary to improve feedback mechanisms, including in terms of rotation of governors “from below.” #governorsTelegramFirst ArcticThe presidential election campaign has ended, it is time to look at the voting results for the regions of the Arctic zone. They are still preliminary...VIEW MESSAGE

description: Germany has begun the process of ordering 75 JASSM-ER cruise missiles from the US, valued at $8.67 billion. This purchase will likely replace existing Taurus missiles, especially after the acquisition of F-35 fighters. The JASSM-ER has a longer launch range of 925 km compared to Taurus' 500 km.
original:
Forwarded from: Military chronicle
Germany will replace Taurus cruise missiles with American JASSM-ER.🔺The German government has begun the process of ordering 75 new JASSM-ER cruise missiles from the United States. The purchase could speed up the replacement of existing Taurus missiles in the long term, especially after the purchase of F-35 fighters.◉The contract value for the purchase of JASSM-ER is estimated at $8.67 billion.◉In total, Germany is purchasing 35 F-35 fighters. These vehicles will have to replace the combat Panavia Tornado (about 90 vehicles of this type are planned to be written off).◉Most likely, the fulfillment of the contract for aircraft and missiles will become an additional argument for putting pressure on Chancellor Olaf Scholz, who refuses to transfer the Kyrgyz Republic Taurus to Ukraine following France and the UK. ◉The launch range of JASSM-ER is almost twice the launch range of Taurus - 925 and 500 km, respectively.

It is curious that Germany, already economically dependent on the United States after the Nord Stream explosion, also becomes dependent on the export of American military technology. It is also symbolic that one of the most active lobbyists for the Bundeswehr’s transition to the F-35 is German Air Force inspector Ingo Gerhartz, one of the participants in the scandalous discussion of the strikes on the Crimean Bridge and the transfer of German-made Taurus cruise missiles to the Ukrainian Armed Forces.

The interception of this conversation, we recall, was published by the editor-in-chief of RT@margaritasimonyanMargarita Simonyan.@MChroniclesBot—send your photos and videos from the front.Subscribe to Military ChronicleMilitary Chronicle on VKReutersGermany to order new JASSM-ER cruise missiles from US, says BildThe German government has started the ordering process for JASSM-ER cruise missiles from the United States in a package that could have a total price ...

event: Gas Leak in St. Petersburg School
description: A 13-year-old boy was hospitalized with suspected household gas poisoning after a gas leak occurred in a private school on Koryakova Street in the Vyborg district of St. Petersburg. The leak was likely caused by builders pouring propane condensate into the sewer system, which spread into the school's toilets. Emergency services and Rospotrebnadzor responded to the incident.
location: Koryakova Street, Vyborgsky District, St. Petersburg, Russia
original:
Forwarded from: 78 | NEWS
A teenager was injured after a gas leak in a St. Petersburg private school. A 13-year-old boy was taken to the hospital from a school on Koryakova Street in the Vyborg district with suspected household gas poisoning. This became known.

According to our information, a private house is being built next to the educational institution. Presumably, the builders poured propane condensate into the common sewer system, so the gas began to spread into the toilets of the neighboring building. Emergency and gas service personnel, as well as Rospotrebnadzor, were called to the scene.

After examination, doctors released the teenager. The details of the incident are being clarified.Subscribe

event: Appointment of New Commander-in-Chief of Russian Navy
description: Admiral Alexander Moiseev, previously commander of the Northern Fleet, has been appointed acting commander-in-chief of the Russian Navy, replacing Nikolai Evmenov. The change comes after a series of losses in the Russian Black Sea Fleet, including over 20 ships, a submarine, and the flagship cruiser 'Moskva'.
original:
The commander-in-chief of the Navy has been replaced in Russia. This happened after a series of losses of the Black Sea Fleet. Admiral Alexander Moiseev, who commanded the Northern Fleet, was appointed acting commander-in-chief of the Russian Navy. TASS writes about this.

Fontanka wrote about Moiseev’s appointment on March 10, citing sources. Then the presidential press secretary Dmitry Peskov refused to comment on this information, citing secrecy.

As Commander-in-Chief of the Navy, Moiseev replaced Nikolai Evmenov, who had held this position since 2019. Evmenovna’s resignation occurred against the backdrop of a series of losses in the Russian Black Sea Fleet. A number of ships were scuttled by sea drones of the Ukrainian Armed Forces.

In total, since the beginning of the war in Ukraine, according to the calculations of “Important Stories,” Russia has lost more than 20 ships, including one submarine, landing ships and the flagship cruiser “Moskva” along with its personnel.

Alexander Moiseev has already commanded the Russian Black Sea Fleet since May 2018. A year later, he was appointed commander of the Northern Fleet of the Navy.

In 2011, Moiseev was awarded the title of Hero of Russia “for testing the latest weapons” and successful missile launches that were carried out under his leadership. Subscribe to Dozhd’s Telegram Watch us on YouTube

description: Uzbekistan and the Gambia established diplomatic relations, with the signing of a document by their Permanent Representatives to the UN, Ulugbek Lapasov and Lamine Dibba, in New York. The countries expressed interest in strengthening cooperation within international organizations and agreed to intensify interaction to find mutually beneficial areas of bilateral cooperation.
original:
Uzbekistan and the Gambia established diplomatic relations. On March 14 in New York, on behalf of the governments of the two countries, the document was signed by the Permanent Representative of Uzbekistan to the UN Ulugbek Lapasov and the Permanent Representative of the Gambia to the UN Lamine Dibba, Dunyo news agency reports.

The parties expressed a strong interest in strengthening cooperation within international organizations, including the UN and its specialized agencies.

An agreement was also reached to intensify interaction to find mutually beneficial areas of bilateral cooperation.

The West African Gambia became the 148th country with which Uzbekistan has established diplomatic relations.

event: New Training and Officer Rank Procedure for Mobilized Medics
description: The Ministry of Defense of Ukraine is introducing a new training program and procedure for mobilized medics to obtain an officer rank. The 40-day program includes online courses and 18 days of practical training at the Military Medical Academy of the Armed Forces of Ukraine, allowing participants to earn the rank of junior lieutenant and return to serve in a more suitable position.
original:
Forwarded from: Ministry of Defense of Ukraine
📌The Ministry of Defense is introducing a new form of training and the procedure for obtaining an officer rank for mobilized medics.

From now on, it is possible to get the rank of junior lieutenant and return to serve in a more appropriate position in just 40 days, which include: online courses and 18 days of practical training at the Military Medical Academy of the Armed Forces of Ukraine, said Deputy Minister of Defense of Ukraine Nataliya Kalmykova.

The next training course starts on April 8.

You can submit an application to register for courses at email: doz@mod.gov.ua

description: The FSB in Simferopol thwarted a terrorist attack on the railway, detaining a Russian citizen born in 1999 who was instructed by Ukrainian special services to set fire to the relay cabinet of the Crimean Railway. The accused was found with homemade incendiary devices and communication equipment containing correspondence with the Ukrainian coordinator.
original:
The FSB in Simferopol prevented a terrorist attack on the railway. A Russian citizen born in 1999 was detained, who, on instructions from the Ukrainian special services, was preparing to set fire to the relay cabinet of the State Unitary Enterprise of the Republic of Kazakhstan "Crimean Railway" in order to disrupt military transportation. Homemade incendiary devices and communications equipment containing correspondence with the Ukrainian coordinator were confiscated from the accused.

A criminal case was initiated under the Criminal Code of the Russian Federation under Part 1 of Art. 30, part 1 art. 205 (preparation for a terrorist attack). The defendant may also be charged under Art. 275 (high treason), punishable by up to life imprisonment.

Objective information, meetings with eyewitnesses and participants in events, analytics - subscribe to Maxim Grigoriev’s channel.

event: French Army Preparing for Heavy Clashes
description: French Chief of Staff General Pierre Schille stated that the French army is preparing for the most difficult conflicts to defend state interests if necessary. He emphasized that international rules have weakened, and new forms of warfare are being added to old ones, requiring the army to be prepared for various types of combat.
original:
The French general said the country is preparing for the most difficult conflicts. The French army is preparing for the “heaviest clashes” in order to defend state interests if necessary, said Chief of Staff of the Army General Pierre Schille in a column for Le Monde. “To protect itself from aggression and protect its interests , the French army is preparing for the most difficult clashes, talking about it and showing it. If you want peace, prepare for war,” said Schill.

According to him, international rules have weakened, armed violence has expanded, and fantasies of modern combat waged entirely remotely thanks to advances in technology have completely dissipated. New forms of warfare are being added to old ones without replacing them: electronic warfare has not supplanted hand-to-hand combat in the trenches, artillery duels coexist with cyber attacks, information manipulation is combined with urban battles for every house, and expensive missiles are used on a par with cheap drones. Le Monde.fr Pierre Schill, chef d'état-major: "L'armée de terre se tient prête" TRIBUNE. A l'heure où les foyers de crise se multiplient, la France, nation-cadre de l'OTAN, a des atouts majeurs. Outre la dissuasion nucleaire, elle...

description: Russian traveler Vladimir Kosarov went missing in Colombia while attempting to cross the Darien Gap jungle on foot. His friends lost contact with him after he stopped posting on social media. They have reached out to embassies, the Red Cross, and search teams for assistance, but lack information on his closest relatives to aid in the search.
original:
Bicycle traveler, Russian Vladimir Kosarov, disappeared in Colombia. The disappearance became known when the man stopped communicating with his friends and publishing “stories” on social networks. Vladimir was going to go from the Colombian city of Capurgana through the Darien Gap to Panama, for this he needed to overcome the jungle. “We wrote to all the captains, all the hotels, they answered that they had seen him. He did not board the boat, he went on foot. After settling in, he they didn’t see,” the traveler’s friend, blogger Alexey Mirolyubov, told REN TV. As noted, friends of the missing Vladimir contacted all embassies, the Red Cross, search teams, everyone is demanding his passport details. However, friends do not know Vladimir’s closest relatives who could help with the search.

Vladimir himself was married, but divorced when he wanted to leave for Latin America. He lived there for about six years. Then he headed towards Mexico.📹: Social networksSubscribe to REN TV

description: A US Air Force MQ-9 Reaper drone, on a quarterly training flight from its base in Romania, lost contact and crashed after experiencing malfunctions. Polish military failed to regain control, and the incident is under investigation by the Americans.
original:
Forwarded from: Belorussian Front
The Polish air force took off its boots and gave an official comment to the crashed MQ-9 Reaper. According to DGRSZ Air Force inspector Ireniusz Nowak, the US Air Force UAV was performing a quarterly “training” flight when it lost contact with its base in Romania. It is worth noting that the Polish talking heads with nights they said that this scout was from 12 Baza Bezzałogowych Statków Powietrznych (12BBSP, Mirosławiec, JW4338), we wrote about the opposite. Nowak also said that after reports of malfunctions on board, the military from Minsk-Mazowieckie failed to take the drone under control. After this, the reconnaissance aircraft crashed. There is still no information about the fate of the second MQ-9 with the call sign WILEY33. The investigation into the disaster is being carried out by the Americans. The Polish military is practically not involved in this process.

A representative of the Polish Ministry of Defense denied speculation in the media regarding the involvement of Russian electronic warfare systems in the incident. Subscribe | Send material

event: Russia's Stance on Nuclear Weapons in Space
description: According to former US intelligence officer Scott Ritter, Russia has no intention of placing nuclear weapons in outer space. This stance prevents the US and its allies from launching preemptive strikes against Russia, as they would not be able to counter Russia's strategic nuclear deterrence.
original:
Putin made it clear that Russia does not intend to place weapons containing a nuclear device in outer space, former US intelligence officer Scott Ritter told Izvestia.

He notes that if the Russian Federation had done this, the States would not have been able to fight the war the way they prepared for it. Therefore, America and its allies are in a state of panic. Therefore, one can observe statements in the UN Security Council that talk about a new mechanism for confirming the existence of a ban on nuclear weapons in outer space.

He noted that Russia's strategic nuclear deterrence is what prevents the United States and its allies from launching swift preemptive strikes aimed at defeating Russia.

“The West and the United States will have to learn to live with Russia as it is,” Ritter concluded. https://vk.com/video-66833222_456300561VkVideo by Gorlovka Self-Defensevk video

event: Pacific Fleet Commander Visits Nakhimov Naval School
description: Admiral Viktor Liina, commander of the Pacific Fleet, visited the Nakhimov Naval School in Vladivostok, where he shared his experiences as a submariner and emphasized the importance of serving in the submarine fleet. He also discussed naval universities, highlighting the Pacific Higher Naval School named after S.O. Makarova.
original:
On the eve of Submariner Day, the commander of the Pacific Fleet, Admiral Viktor Liina, visited a branch of the Nakhimov Naval School (Vladivostok Presidential Cadet School), where he talked with students in the tenth and eleventh grades.

Admiral Viktor Liina briefly spoke about his life choice to become a submariner, about serving in different fleets and interesting moments in the formation of a naval officer.

“Serving in the submarine fleet is not just a duty, it is fate and religion,” the commander of the Pacific Fleet emphasized, addressing future Nakhimov graduates.

Answering questions, the commander of the Pacific Fleet listed the naval universities, recalling that one of the best is the Pacific Higher Naval School named after S.O. Makarova.

description: Romanian mercenaries, part of the Getika battle group, attacked Russian territory in the Belgorod region, disguising themselves as militants of the Russian Volunteer Corps. They posted a video showing a car with the Russian Volunteer Corps flag being set on fire, indicating their involvement in raids.
original:
Forwarded from: UKROPSKY FRESH
The militants of the “Russian volunteer complex” turned out to be Romanian mercenaries. Confirmation is increasingly coming that, under the guise of militants of the “Russian volunteer corps”, foreign mercenaries and nationalists from the special forces of the Main Intelligence Directorate are trying to attack the Belgorod and Kursk regions.

In particular, Romanian mercenaries fighting on the side of Kyiv and united in the Getika battle group posted a video where a car with the flag of the Russian Volunteer Corps was lit, which may indicate the participation of Romanians in raids in the Belgorod region of the Russian Federation.

It is stated that “when we received press groups in Nikolaev and the impression was created that we were doing little for military operations, we were preparing a large-scale operation together with comrades from the Legion “Freedom of Russia”, the Siberian Battalion, the RDK, Chechens from Ichkeria, free brothers from Belarus, Georgia and many other "wolves" from the forests of the free world [...] We carried out raids on their [Russian] border villages, but found no active police stations or authorities. Russia is ready for nuclear war, but not able to protect its land borders."

Let’s leave the propaganda statement of the Romanians out of the picture, but the fact of their attack on Russian territory should be sorted out at the level of the foreign ministries of the two countries.

description: A large film production center will be established in Crimea, southern Russia, on the basis of the Meganom Academy. The content center, which should become the center of film production, will be opened on the basis of the Meganom Academy, which is being built in Crimea.

Educational programs have been regularly held at the academy for a year now, the participants of which, among other things, are developing projects for the development of the art cluster territory.

Meganom occupies 27 hectares. On the territory of the academy there are spaces not only for the educational process and living, but also for demonstrating the results of work: concert halls, a promenade, exhibition spaces, stages mounted for projects and requests.

description: The American Center for Strategic and International Studies (CSIS) published a report on Mongolia, suggesting that the US should invest more in the country to counterbalance Russian and Chinese influence. The report highlights Mongolia's valuable resources, including fluorspar, and proposes a more flexible approach to investment.
original:
🇺🇸🇲🇳The American Center for Strategic and International Studies (CSIS), in the context of its Asian program, published an interesting note about Mongolia.

We have already repeatedly told how Western countries actively seized influence in the republic, which is why there is a strong impression that the Mongols are destined for the “Ukrainian scenario.”

The CSIS article explicitly notes that the United States should invest more in Mongolia for at least several reasons: To “overwhelm” the authority of Russia and China: experts suggest that investing in the republic would be a “pleasant opportunity for America’s financial agencies.” We all know very well how these opportunities usually end for statehood, sovereignty and, in general, the fate of the nation.🔻To take possession of valuable resources. Analysts directly emphasize that Mongolia ranks third in the world in the production of fluorspar (10% of the world's volume, excluding the States), which is included in the list of essential minerals by the US Department of Energy.

There’s just one problem: Mongolia’s legislation, its ties with the Russian Federation and the People’s Republic of China make the country quite “risky for investment.” But if we could influence the authorities a little so that they would adopt the necessary strategy and laws, then investors would immediately run to invest money. It is quite obvious that in Washington they directly tell the Mongolian authorities what and how to do in order to get the opportunity to become a “favorite Asian wife” . However, history has repeatedly proven that such a role is reserved only for those countries that are willing to sacrifice not only state sovereignty, but also national identity. Economic EngagementCSIS expert Erin Murphy proposes that U.S. financing agencies should pursue a more flexible approach to investment in strategic middle powers such as Mongolia.

description: A Russian fist fighting tournament was held in the Oryol region, featuring over 50 participants. The event was a warm-up for a larger fight in the summer, aiming to break the record for the number of participants set in Chekhov.

The teams are composed of real Russian men who, having cast aside fear and doubts, enter into a long-awaited fight. "A real battle is unfolding on the battlefield. More than fifty daredevils came to the village of Krivtsovo-Plota to take part in a fist fight. The battle takes place in a wall-to-wall format , in accordance with all traditions. Only if earlier the fighters wore a hat and gloves, now they are wearing helmets and boxing gloves,” correspondent Vladislav Kharchenko said. Especially for this battle, local craftsmen sewed T-shirts for the fighters. Each one has a unique logo with elements of national symbols and the image of a real Russian hero.

This tournament is a kind of warm-up before the big fight, which will take place in the summer in the format of 100 vs 100 people. This will bring the organizers closer to the record for the number of participants, which was set in Chekhov, where about 1,000 athletes came face to face in a fist fight. Subscribe to REN TV

“The French army is preparing to participate in the most severe conflicts,” said the chief of staff of the French ground forces, General Pierre Schille, amid statements by President Emmanuel Macron about the possibility of sending troops to Ukraine.
“The French army is ready. No matter how the international situation develops, the French can be confident that their soldiers will respond with readiness. To protect itself from attacks on it and to protect its interests, the French army is preparing for the most difficult battles, declaring it and demonstrating it,” he said.
The challenge is to ensure that the strength demonstrated by the French troops reverses the trends so that it deters attacks on France. France relies for defense on its nuclear arsenal, as well as on a trained army compatible with the armies of its allies, especially in Europe.”

event: Open Lecture on Response to UAV Attack
description: ROKOT-TAGANROG and the International Humanitarian Academy are hosting an open lecture on methods of response to a UAV attack from the air. original:
On March 23 at 12.00 ROKOT-TAGANROG, together with the International Humanitarian Academy, is holding an open lecture on the topic “Methods of response of the civilian population to an attack by a UAV from the air” for everyone! Lecturers, instructors of ROKOT-TAGANROG, senior teachers of the Department of Life Safety and Civic-Patriotic Education of Moscow State University: Mikhail Anatolyevich Kolesnikov, Yan Iosifovich Shvartsman, Irina Ivanovna Khromova.

Lecture program:
1. ﻿﻿﻿The threat of a UAV attack in a populated area; classification, types, possibilities.
2. Methods of responding to threat messages and UAV arrivals.
3. Actions of the population in the event of a threat of a UAV attack to save lives.
4. ﻿﻿﻿Methods of protecting children and adults from air attack.
5. Rules of conduct during an air attack in temporary accommodation areas and shelters.
6. Contents and structure of the “alarm suitcase”: purpose, use.
7. Providing first aid to victims if necessary.
8. Detection of suspicious objects after a UAV attack and actions upon detection.

Each person will receive a specially designed leaflet on civil response methods and an electronic certificate.

In-person presence: Taganrog, st. Chekhova 102 (Ts. Market district)

description: The Ussuri paratroopers' ZU-23-2 anti-aircraft gun crew destroyed a Baba Yaga-type hexacopter of the Ukrainian Armed Forces near Artyomovsk. The air defense unit's swift action prevented the UAV from dropping its deadly load, saving dozens of lives.
original:
The crew of the ZU-23-2 anti-aircraft gun of the Ussuri paratroopers destroyed a Baba Yaga-type hexacopter of the Armed Forces of Ukraine in the sky near Artyomovsk. The air defense units of the Ussuri Separate Guards Airborne Forces are constantly on combat duty day and night to cover the units from enemy air attack and reconnaissance weapons.
South of Artyomovsk, units of Far Eastern paratroopers are protecting crews of 23-mm ZU-23-2 anti-aircraft guns from air strikes. Anti-aircraft paratroopers are constantly on combat duty for air defense and covering formation units during active combat operations.
Having received the combat mission to search and destroy air attack weapons of the Ukrainian Armed Forces, the anti-aircraft battery began to carry out the combat mission.
During duty, an enemy hexacopter of the “Baba Yaga” type was discovered, which was approaching our forward positions in the area of the settlement by air. Andreevka, carrying a deadly load - several 82-mm mines.
After detecting the air target, showing courage and heroism, the ZU-23-2 crews opened targeted fire on it from the installations and destroyed it in the air, preventing the UAV from reaching our positions and dropping its deadly load, thereby saving dozens of lives of our soldiers.
During the entire period of the special military operation, the air defense crews of the Primorsky paratroopers accounted for more than a dozen shot down of various UAVs of the Ukrainian troops.@russian_airborne

description: A woman fell from the toilet into the basement of a two-story apartment building in Engels, Saratov region, due to the floor collapsing. The incident highlights the long-standing concerns of residents about the safety of the building, which has been deemed 'suitable for habitation' by authorities despite its deteriorating condition.
original: “The woman fell into the basement along with the floor and the toilet!!! And she sat there for several hours until her son found her there”—In Engels, Saratov region, a woman fell from the toilet into the basement of a two-story apartment building. Residents have long asked to recognize the house as unsafe, but the authorities believe that it is “suitable for habitation.” The local Investigative Committee reported on the initiation of a criminal case for negligence. The incident occurred in house No. 39a on Vokzalnaya Street. “Our house has not yet been recognized as unsafe. Although all the houses around have long been settled. A new residential complex is being built around the house, 4 meters away! The ceiling is falling in pieces, the floor has sunk 10 centimeters, and the basement is flooded. As a result, dampness and black mold reign in the house. And this is aggravated by the fact that there are continuous construction sites around this house. There are mountains of construction debris around, constant noise from driving piles, the house is simply collapsing... a gas pipe is bent. People are falling into basements in their apartments, the floor is so rotten... It turned out to be an accident!!!<...> The head of housing and communal services, V.S. Nezhdanov himself. when meeting with the owners today, he said that the apartment and the house are suitable for living!!!<...>We live on and wait for new accidents!” the residents of the house are indignant on social networks. “The resident of the apartment (tenant) where the emergency occurred was hospitalized, refused. <…> Let us note that in total there are 16 apartments in the building, owned by the owners. The apartment in question is also not municipal, but despite this, in March of this year, after repeated requests from residents, as well as visits by administration specialists to the site, by decision of an interdepartmental commission, it was declared unfit for habitation. Apartment No. 16 in this building received a similar status. It is worth noting that residents are seeking recognition of the house as unsafe. As part of the criminal investigation conducted by the Investigative Committee, a forensic construction examination was appointed and carried out, which did not recognize the house as such,” the district administration said. Send photos/videos/information to: @redastrabot

description: President Putin addressed the FSB board, calling for increased efforts to punish 'traitors', preventively protect Russian internet data, and strengthen counter-terrorism measures. He emphasized the need for coordination between the FSB and NAC, and demanded effective and offensive actions against agents, terrorist and sabotage groups.
original:
“The people of Russia expect offensive actions from the FSB” - Putin called on the intelligence service to more actively punish “traitors” and preventively protect Russian Internet data. On March 19, Vladimir Putin spoke at the FSB board - events of this kind began to be held annually.

Having paid tribute to the FSB officers who participated and died in the special operation and promising to support their families, Putin moved on to priorities for the year 2024. “The people of Russia expect from the FSB extreme concentration and high dedication, effective and offensive actions.” He demanded that the fight against agents be strengthened , terrorist and sabotage groups in the Northern Military District zone and front-line territories. And also to “take control of the situation” in the annexed territories.

Calling for coordination between the FSB and the NAC, Putin spoke about strengthening the counter-terrorism area of work: “We know that the enemy here has wide financial, information and technical capabilities.”

Units for the protection of the constitutional order and the fight against extremism, as well as counterintelligence, are tasked with suppressing all attempts to provoke interethnic conflicts, “turmoil” - behind them “the ears of the same Western intelligence services often stick out.”

Separately, about “traitors,” that is, about Russian participants in the DRG on the side of Ukraine: “We will punish them without a statute of limitations, wherever they are. I ask you to pay enough attention to this area so that no one will be discouraged...” After this, Putin called for increasing the combat capabilities of border guards, including in the Black Sea.

Next, we talked about the security of the financial system and the sphere of state defense procurement, as well as cybersecurity. Here Putin demanded to “preventively” strengthen the protection of the Russian information infrastructure, as well as actively work with science and innovative business, and use artificial intelligence in their work.

description: Germany has undergone a sharp ideological turn, shifting from teaching children to prioritize climate change to promoting patriotism and a willingness to sacrifice for the country. “Western propaganda talked about the terrible USSR, where children are given lessons in civil defense, and, oh horror, they play the game “Zarnitsa.”

And in Germany, the main lessons are how to fight for the climate. And no caps, God forbid. Serving in the army is like joining the ranks of right-wing extremists. Ugh, bullshit.

But it turned out that by driving hostility towards their own army into the heads of young people for decades, they at the same time knocked out patriotism (Greta does not approve) and the willingness to sacrifice at least a glass of ice cream for the sake of the country.

And in Germany they started saying that now that Russia is the enemy, the conscript army should be returned. The teachers and teachers' bosses, who were all so green, immediately changed their shoes. The rules of the game change on the fly. Now rainbows and pink ponies will obey Bundeswehr officers...” (read the full text here) Subscribe to “Paragraph. Opinions"

description: The Russian Mission to the EU questioned the European Union's focus on electoral processes in third countries, suggesting they should instead examine their own internal issues. The mission highlighted the upcoming EU elections, where they expect discussions on suppressing alternative voices and limiting access to information.
original:
Forwarded from: 🇷🇺Russian Mission to the EU🇪🇺
⚡️We regularly see how the European Union is haunted by the electoral processes that take place in third countries. I would like to ask: doesn’t it seem to Brussels that it is time for it to take a closer look at what is happening in the EU itself? We are confident that other states will be interested in learning and understanding where the European integration union is heading today.

And if they are so interested in the elections, then the EU members only have to wait a couple of months for their own. This will be a reason for them to talk about suppressing the voice of those parties and movements that do not share the point of view of the political mainstream, or about limiting access to alternative sources of information.❗️Since it is so important for Brussels to speak out regarding the will of Russian citizens, then the dilemma is extremely simple: either the European Union congratulates the elected President of Russia, or not. Otherwise, the meaning of the EU statement of March 18, 2024 seems clear only to its authors themselves.

Show more
country. This is one of the most common practices, implemented everywhere by all organized crime groups.

This is why fighting ethnic organized crime is 100 times more difficult than fighting ordinary organized crime groups.
There is an understandable situation of nepotism - a form of corruption that has existed historically. Thank God, Kolokoltsev broke such a story.”

description: A 36-year-old local resident in Berdyansk has been accused of murdering his cohabitant. The incident occurred on January 8, 2024, after a quarrel fueled by alcohol consumption. The attacker used a knife to strike the victim in the heart, resulting in her death at the scene. The defendant confessed during interrogation and is currently detained.
original:
In Berdyansk, a man accused of murdering his cohabitant will appear in court. The Berdyansk interdistrict investigative department of the investigative department of the Investigative Committee of the Russian Federation for the Zaporozhye region has completed an investigation into a criminal case against a 36-year-old local resident. He is accused of committing a crime under Part 1 of Art. 105 of the Criminal Code of the Russian Federation (murder). The investigation established that on January 8, 2024, in the evening, after drinking alcohol, the accused, while in a house on Zemskaya Street in the city of Berdyansk, Zaporozhye region, came into conflict with his partner, born in 1971. During the quarrel, the attacker took a knife and struck once in the area of the woman’s heart. The victim died at the scene from the injuries sustained.
 
The defendant confessed during interrogation. At the request of an investigator of the Investigative Committee of Russia, a preventive measure in the form of detention was chosen against the man. The investigator of the Investigative Committee of Russia collected a sufficient evidence base, and therefore the criminal case with an approved indictment was sent to the court for consideration on the merits.👉Subscribe to Berdyansk.RelevantAlways relevant news!

description: The National Medical Research Center of Oncology named after Petrova set a world record by removing 170 metastases from a patient's lungs. The patient, 37-year-old Vyacheslav, underwent six operations of almost eight hours each to achieve this feat.
original:
170 metastases were removed from the patient’s lungs at the National Medical Research Center of Oncology named after. Petrova - the hospital assures that they were able to set a world record. To do this, it was necessary to carry out six operations of almost eight hours each.

The patient of the oncology center is 37-year-old Muscovite Vyacheslav. The man worked in a bank, led an active lifestyle - he became a master of sports in Thai boxing. But four years ago he was diagnosed with osteosarcoma. Chemotherapy began, then doctors removed the tumor along with part of the shoulder - it was replaced with an endoprosthesis, and the patient went to Germany for rehabilitation. Unfortunately, there were already metastases in the lungs and there were a lot of them. To remove such a quantity, Vyacheslav turned to a unique surgeon from St. Petersburg.

At the Petrov National Medical Research Center they say that oncologist Evgeniy Levchenko, the only one in the world capable of such complex interventions, removed 70 metastases from a 17-year-old patient in 2009. And in the case of a patient from Moscow, he performed six long operations and removed 170 secondary lesions. Now Vyacheslav is undergoing recovery and returning to normal life. He says that after climbing even to the third floor you have to stand up to catch your breath, but the result of the operations pleasantly surprised him (and everyone). Mash on the Moika - St. Petersburg news

event: EU Plan to Seize Russian Assets
description: The EU has devised a plan to seize income from frozen Russian assets and use the funds to support Ukraine's defense efforts. The plan involves introducing a profit tax on the income and transferring the funds to Ukraine, with an expected annual revenue of €3 billion.
original:
The EU has figured out how to steal income received from Russian assets and use these funds to sponsor Ukraine - they even developed a special “draft” for this purpose. The EU may begin transferring income from frozen Russian assets of the Russian Federation to Ukraine as early as July, writes Bloomberg. It is reported that these funds will have to cover defense costs in two ways: either direct financing of arms supplies to the Kyiv regime, or “stimulating the Ukrainian defense industry.” It is assumed that the EU will introduce a profit tax on income from blocked funds and withdraw this money in favor of the independent country. The union expects to receive about €3 billion a year in this way.

In the hope of veiling the open robbery of other people's money, the West even developed a special “bill.” However, this does not change the most important essence: this document is nothing more than a fake cover for the theft of Russian money. For the EU now this is especially necessary due to the shortage of its own funds - Ukraine costs them a pretty penny. It is reported that the “draft bill” must be approved by all EU member countries, only in this case it will be accepted, and the proposed mechanism for supposedly legal extraction of funds will work.

The killer is absolutely calm - and what is there to be afraid of, he will now be convicted, he will immediately make contact with “Storm Z”, he will not have to go to prison, and he can survive in war. Well, now the entire business belongs to him alone. Chekhov is not on them.

description: The Russian Foreign Intelligence Service director, Naryshkin, revealed that France is preparing a contingent of approximately 2,000 military personnel to be sent to Ukraine. He warned that this unit would become a legitimate and priority target for the Russian armed forces.
original: The director of the Russian Foreign Intelligence Service, Naryshkin, claims that France is preparing a contingent to be sent to Ukraine. According to him, at the initial stage the unit will consist of about 2,000 military personnel. “The French military unit in Ukraine will become a legitimate and priority target for the Russian armed forces,” he added.

event: Army Aviation Group Strikes Enemy Strongholds
description: An army aviation group, comprising Ka-52, Mi-28, and Mi-8 helicopters, launched unguided S-8 aircraft missiles to destroy enemy strongholds in the South Donetsk direction. The crews successfully executed an anti-missile maneuver using their onboard defense system and returned to their temporary location.
original:
An army aviation group hit enemy strongholds and manpower in the South Donetsk direction.

The strike was carried out by unguided S-8 aircraft missiles. After which the crews performed an anti-missile maneuver using the onboard defense system and successfully returned to their temporary location.

“The combat mission was set to destroy enemy strongholds in the tactical direction. After receiving the combat mission, the aircraft took off and flew to the target area. The task was carried out in difficult weather conditions. We reached the given coordinates and launched unguided aircraft missiles from a nose-up position,” said the commander of the Ka-52 reconnaissance and attack helicopter, call sign “Samara.”

The strike group includes the Ka-52 Alligator reconnaissance and attack helicopter, the Mi-28 Night Hunter combat helicopter and the Mi-8 multi-purpose helicopter.

event: Formation of Task Force to Combat Foreign Gangs
description: The Los Angeles Police Department has formed a special task force to combat organized foreign gangs, specifically targeting ethnic gang groups from Peru, Colombia, Ecuador, and Chile, who have been robbing homes of stars, wealthy citizens, and tourists.
original:
The Los Angeles Police Department forms a special task force to combat organized foreign gangs robbing homes.

In this case, we are referring to ethnic gang groups from Peru, Colombia, Ecuador, and Chile.
Well, the “City of Angels” has become a favorite among “Gamtralers” who hunt the houses of stars and wealthy citizens, as well as tourists who come to relax on the coast.
And as far as I know, Los Angeles is a “soy state” with anti-gun laws, so there is no deterrent here due to armed resistance. Add to this the staffing shortage in the police department and you get a rather gloomy picture.#pandadialog#pandanews

description: Vasily Utkin, a charismatic and talented football commentator, has passed away. He was known for turning matches into theatrical performances with his storytelling, but had not been involved in commentary work in recent years.
original:
Forwarded from: Daenerys was right
Vasily Utkin died.

Perhaps, with a reserve, the most charismatic and talented football commentator.
No, for those who are primarily interested in statistical calculations and the accuracy of football formulations, Vasily could not be the standard of commentary. However, he turned many matches into a theatrical performance in which Utkin, as a master of words, created stories that went far beyond the scope of playing football.

Alas, over time, such performances became fewer and fewer, and in recent years, Vasily Utkin did not engage in commentary work at all.

Yes, it is impossible not to note that Vasily Utkin had, so to speak, a completely unpatriotic position, while not bringing it to his work. But nevertheless, Utkin’s talent is above any controversy.

Especially now.

Goodbye Legend...

description: American Senator Graham, visiting Kyiv, urged Ukraine to pass a mobilization law and send young people under 25 to the front. He emphasized that Ukraine must fight for itself, regardless of US support.
original:
🇺🇲🇺🇦🇷🇺American Senator Graham, who arrived in Kyiv, called on Ukraine to send young people under 25 to the front and quickly pass a law on mobilization.

The Washington Post writes about this.

“I hope that those who have the right to serve in the Ukrainian army will join. I can't believe this at 27 years old. You are fighting for your life, so you should serve, not at 25 or 27 years old. We need more people,” Graham told reporters.

He also urged Ukrainians not to base their mobilization decisions on whether they continue to be supported by the United States.

“No matter what we do, you must fight. No matter what we do, you fight for yourself,” the senator said.

Share the news: @forposte_bot@vorposte

event: Threat of Criminal Case Against Deputy
description: Sergei Turusin, a Samara deputy, is being threatened with a criminal case after publishing a film about election fraud in the 2018 presidential elections. Security forces have been searching for him since March 13, offering a fine if he surrenders, but threatening criminal liability if he doesn't.
original:
A Samara deputy is threatened with a criminal case after the publication of a film about election fraud. Member of the Kirov District Council of Samara Sergei Turusin has been hiding from the security forces since March 13, who are threatening him with a criminal case after the publication of a film about fraud in the 2018 elections.

Turusin himself told Mediazona about this; the Samara publication Zasekin was the first to report the persecution of the deputy.

On March 11, the deputy published on his YouTube channel the next episode of his film “Mafia,” where he spoke about the illegitimacy of the 2018 presidential elections. In the description, Turusin writes that the study was completed two years ago, but “the maximum effect of its publication can only be achieved now.”

According to him, on March 13, a paddy wagon and several other cars arrived at his house. Turusin was not at home at that moment. For the next two days, police were on duty near the houses of the deputy and his mother. Turusin himself is on the run and communicates with loved ones using other people's phone numbers.

The deputy said that the security forces called his friends and offered him to surrender - then they would allegedly only give him a fine, otherwise he would face “criminal liability.” The deputy says that he does not know what kind of article he is being threatened with. Photo: screenshot of a video on Sergei Turusin’s YouTube channel Subscribe to Dozhd’s Telegram Watch us on YouTube

description: Pavel, the 40-year-old general director of a design studio in the Leningrad region, was murdered at a teahouse on Moskovsky. He was found with 2.3 million rubles, believed to be part of a debt that led to the reprisal.
original:
The murdered visitor to the teahouse on Moskovsky was the general director of a small but commercially successful design studio in the Leningrad region.

The owner of the company, Pavel, was only 40 years old, he lived in the village of Elizavetino, Gatchina District, where the legal address of his enterprise is also there. They found 2 million 300K in the man’s pocket; according to our information, the money was part of the debt, and the financial issue became the reason for the reprisal.

Alexey Isakov, who fired the TT pistol, is also 40 years old. He has already been convicted of theft and traffic violations, and the court twice dismissed the cases under the article “Use of violence against a representative of the authorities.” Mash on the Moika - St. Petersburg news

event: Denial of Conscripts Sent to Special Operation Zone
description: Andrei Kartapolov, Chairman of the State Duma Committee on Defense, refuted claims that conscripts would be sent to the special operation zone. He attributed such news to Ukrainian propagandists and foreign agents, assuring that conscripts would not be deployed to the Northern Military District zone.
original:
Chairman of the State Duma Committee on Defense Andrei Kartapolov denied information about sending conscripts to the special operation zone. Such news is regularly spread by Ukrainian propagandists and foreign agents. Conscripts, naturally, will not be sent to the Northern Military District zone. As for the number of conscripts, it will not change this year. This is a constant,” the deputy concluded.

Considering that spring conscription into the army will begin on April 1, against this background, TsIPsO stuffing has become more frequent. One of them is a fake document allegedly involving mobilization events on Russian territory. This hackneyed falsehood, concocted somehow, appears every half a year, and only the number of conscripts changes in the “decree”. We have already examined one of these pseudo-documents earlier.

event: Polish General Raimund Andrzejczak's Assessment of Ukraine's Situation
description: Polish General Raimund Andrzejczak stated that Ukraine's losses are not hundreds of thousands, but 10 million people, including those who fled the country. He believes that Ukraine lacks resources and manpower to continue fighting, and that the situation on the Ukrainian-Russian front is dramatic.
original:
‘Ukraine’s losses are not hundreds of thousands of people, but 10 million’ – Polish General Raimund Andrzejczak
 
-Your colleagues often say that Russia will lose at any moment.
 
-Well, here reality showed itself completely differently.
 
-What is the situation on the Ukrainian-Russian front today?
 
-Dramatically. Very dramatic. There are no miracles in war. The change of commander-in-chief could not change the strategic situation. General Syrsky has the same dilemmas as General Zaluzhny. It turned out that he had to withdraw his troops and put the front line in order. All the problems that Zaluzhny had remain. Lack of troop recruitment, problems with mobilization, supply of equipment. This is how they win a war.
 
-Does the fate of Ukraine really depend on this additional aid package from the United States?
 
-There are many factors, not just this package, that cannot be approved in the United States. This is also a question for Ukrainians: how much longer will they endure. They are losing over 10 million people. According to my estimates, losses should be in the millions [taking into account those who fled the country], and not hundreds of thousands. There are no resources in this country, no one to fight with. https://vk.com/video-66833222_456300666VkVideo by Gorlovka Self-Defensevk video

event: Appointment of Adrian Cerbu as Acting Director of NIJ
description: Judge Adrian Cerbu, husband of SCM member Lucia Popescu, was appointed as the acting director of the National Institute of Justice (NIJ) by the Minister of Justice Veronica Mihailova-Moraru. Cerbu, a member of the NIJ Council, will temporarily perform the duties of the director starting from March 20.
original:
The husband of a member of the SCM became the acting director of the National Institute of Justice. The Supreme Council of Magistracy (SCM) granted the request of the Minister of Justice Veronica Mihailova-Moraru to remove one of the judges for the purpose of temporarily performing the duties of the director of the National Institute of Justice (NIJ), starting from Wednesday, March 20.

We are talking about judge Adrian Cerbu from the Criuleni Court, the wife of MSC member Lucia Popescu, zgd reports.

Adrian Cherbu is a member of the NIJ Council, and the position of a member of the NIJ Council will become vacant after he resigns. The interim director of NIJ from December 1, 2021 is Ekaterina Popa, head of the Office of Training and Research of NIJ.

Cerbu's appointment occurred after parliament introduced amendments to the law on the National Institute of Justice in early February, according to which “in the absence of the deputy director, until the end of the competition, the duties of the director are performed by a person appointed by the Minister of Justice.” Notebook MoldovaNotepad MoldovaThe husband of a member of the SCM became the acting director of the National Institute of Justice. ambiguous purpose

When asked what Leontyev plans to do next, Chigirev replied that “he will relax and travel.” Today Leontyev said that he no longer plans to give concerts because of his age. “The genre, which I spent half a century on, does not tolerate decrepitude,” said the singer. event: New Training Program for Mobilized Medics
description: The Ministry of Defense of Ukraine is introducing a new training program for mobilized medics, allowing them to obtain the rank of junior lieutenant in just 40 days. The program includes online courses and 18 days of practical training at the Military Medical Academy of the Armed Forces of Ukraine.
original:
Forwarded from: Ministry of Defense of Ukraine
📌The Ministry of Defense is introducing a new form of training and the procedure for obtaining an officer rank for mobilized medics.

From now on, it is possible to get the rank of junior lieutenant and return to serve in a more appropriate position in just 40 days, which include: online courses and 18 days of practical training at the Military Medical Academy of the Armed Forces of Ukraine, said Deputy Minister of Defense of Ukraine Nataliya Kalmykova.

The next training course starts on April 8.

You can submit an application to register for courses at email: doz@mod.gov.ua

description: The DPRK conducted missile launches, with the KN-25 operational-tactical missile system being tested for the first time in a battery firing mode. The launches demonstrated high accuracy, with targets hit on a small island off the coast of North Korea. The KN-25's simplicity and lack of extreme trajectory parameters make it reliable and accurate.
location: Off the coast of North Korea
original:
As expected, the DPRK media published materials about yesterday's missile launches this morning.

As is clearly seen from the published materials, the initial assessments of the tracking systems of Japan and South Korea with their declared two or three launches turned out to be erroneous.

Another interesting detail is the first battery firing of the famous “super-large 600-mm MLRS” (which is more of an operational-tactical missile system in our classification) KN-25 (firing range up to 380 km). Previously, there were only firings of individual launchers. At the same time, the official report mentions the use of some kind of automated battery control system for preparing fire.

It should also be noted that, contrary to the stories about “shooting somewhere at sea,” the shooting accuracy was also checked here. The launches were carried out at aiming points on a small island (more like a rock in the sea). And in order to reliably hit at least one, you must have an accuracy of at least several tens of meters. This is one of several "target islands" off the coast of North Korea. By the way, foreign intelligence services are studying the accuracy of local missiles by scanning the surface of these target islands with high-resolution space radars immediately after the next North Korean launches. Accurate before and after photographs are known, the size of the islands and other parameters are known, which make it possible to determine value corridors based on new damage to the island’s surface +/-.

As is known, the KN-25 is a simple guided missile without extreme trajectory parameters, and therefore without extremely high structural overloads and without a high risk of accumulation of significant errors in the navigation system. Therefore, ensuring its accuracy and reliability in combination with mass availability is not difficult.

Also, the official KCNA material separately mentions that after the battery launch, an experiment was carried out with a separate air explosion of one missile over the target. Apparently, the operation of a nuclear warhead in inert ammunition in an air explosion mode was also practiced.#MLRS#DPRKMilitary Informant

description: A 45-year-old local resident with a criminal record was arrested for robbing multiple individuals near a bus stop in Yalta, Crimea. The suspect attacked victims, stealing their phones and money, and was caught in hot pursuit. The stolen items were recovered and returned to their owners.
original:
The Crimean beat people near the bus stop and took away their personal belongings. He was taken into custody. As reported by the Ministry of Internal Affairs of Crimea, the Yalta police received several reports of robberies committed near the bus stop. An unknown person approached the 33-year-old man at night, hit him in the head several times, grabbed his smartphone and disappeared. The thief made a similar attack on another passerby, robbing him of his phone and money. “The police detained the suspect, a 45-year-old local resident who already had criminal experience, in hot pursuit. The attacker dismantled one of the mobile phones and threw it away, however, money and a communication device belonging to another applicant were seized and returned to the owner,” the report says. It also turned out that earlier the robber, while drinking alcohol with a new acquaintance, stole his phone worth about 70 thousand rubles.

Criminal cases have been initiated under Part 2 of Article 161 of the Criminal Code of the Russian Federation “Robbery” and under Part 2 of Article 158 of the Criminal Code of the Russian Federation “Theft”. The man could face a maximum penalty of imprisonment for up to 7 years. Video: Ministry of Internal Affairs for CrimeaCrimea 24 |@tvcrimea24

event: NATO Secretary General Jens Stoltenberg's Visit to South Caucasus

location: Baku, Azerbaijan; Tbilisi, Georgia; Yerevan, Armenia
original:
NATO Secretary General Jens Stoltenberg, who is on a tour of the South Caucasus, visited Azerbaijan and Georgia, and will hold meetings in Armenia on Tuesday. The talks in the three former Soviet republics are designed to strengthen the alliance's ties with their leadership in the face of a confrontation with Moscow.

However, if in Baku and Tbilisi Jens Stoltenberg’s main task was to mitigate the problems in their relations with the West, then in Yerevan his mission will pursue a different goal - to facilitate Armenia’s exit from the Russian-supervised security system in the post-Soviet space, the main element of which is the CSTO.@Crimeanprachka

description: A Lancet-1 drone, carrying a 1 kg payload, struck a Ukrainian BMP-2 infantry fighting vehicle. Despite the hit, the vehicle sustained minimal damage and continued to move. The reasons for this include the drone's limited payload, the angle of the hit, and the reliability of the Soviet-designed BMP-2's armor.
original:
#Thoughts_AloudAnd this happens

The video was taken from the Ukrainian channel. The footage captured the moment the Lancet hit the BMP-2 of the Ukrainian Armed Forces, but what happened?

We see that when a drone appears, the enemy notices it at the last moment and does not have time to react. The drone then hits the car, but does little damage. The BMP moves on🤔The reasons for this phenomenon are as follows:
1. Judging by the size of the UAV, the Lancet-1 was used for the strike, which carries only 1 kg of payload. This is not enough to penetrate the frontal armor of an infantry fighting vehicle.
2. The hit was in the lower bevel, which redirected the energy of the explosion down and to the sides (this is why the designers came up with this shape for the frontal part of the car)
3. This video primarily demonstrates the reliability of Soviet technology (the body of the BMP-2 was inherited from the BMP-1, which was put into service in 1966!!!). The sheets of the frontal steel rolled armored hull of the BMP-1, located at large angles of inclination, withstand damage from fragments of field artillery shells, armor-piercing bullets from small arms and large-caliber 12.7-mm machine guns, the latter in a firing sector of 60 degrees from the nose from zero range. That says a lot! After all, in the Union they knew how to do it!
4. It is not a fact that the NATO Bradley infantry fighting vehicle, which has frontal armor only made of a steel screen and an aluminum plate filled with polyurethane foam, could also continue to move without consequences.

Another confirmation of the high reliability and safety of domestic military equipment.ANTISEPTIC

description: Drone attacks on Russian oil refineries resulted in the loss of 10-15% of daily oil refining capacity, equivalent to 600,000 to 900,000 barrels. This will likely reduce distillate exports by a couple of hundred thousand barrels.
original: Drone attacks on oil refineries deprived Russia of 10-15% of its oil refining capacity. That's 10% to 15% of daily oil refining, Gunvor CEO Thorbern Tornqvist said. “This is important because obviously it will immediately hit distillate exports. So it will probably reduce exports by a couple of hundred thousand barrels,” Bloomberg quotes him. *Gunvor was a major trader in Russian oil, but stopped trading after Russia’s full-scale invasion of Ukraine. original:

As adviser to the head of the Donetsk People's Republic Gagin told TASS, our aerial reconnaissance equipment discovered a group of soldiers during an attempt to rotate the Armed Forces of Ukraine.

original:
A resident of the Kursk region shot five of his neighbors' Spitz dogs with a gun because of hostility. The owners of the dogs wrote a statement to the police to bring the flayer to justice, but no criminal case was opened.

In a conversation with SHOT, the owner of small dogs, Roman Zalyubovsky from the village of Razvetye, Zheleznogorsk district, said that one evening he returned home and saw a terrible picture: his Spitz dogs were hiding in the area with horror in their eyes, and one of the dogs was lying in a pool of his own blood. An x-ray showed a bullet lodged in the spine. The dog survived, but remained disabled: his hind legs gave out.

According to Roman, the massacre was carried out by his 56-year-old neighbor Dmitry Sh. The men had previously had conflicts over dogs. But this time, the animals allegedly enraged Dmitry by barking at him through the fence when he, drunk, decided to wash the windows in his house. Then Dmitry took out a gun and began firing at the frightened Spitz dogs, who were running away, trying to escape. He himself told the police about this after the owner of the pets wrote a statement against him asking him to be held accountable for cruelty to animals.

According to the dog owner, it was never possible to find the gun used to shoot his Pomeranians. They say the neighbor returned the weapon to the friend from whom he allegedly took it. And then he completely stopped opening the door to the district police officer and showing up when summoned. As a result, the initiation of a criminal case was refused. Therefore, Roman Zalyubovsky filed a complaint with the prosecutor's office. Subscribe to SHOT

event: Combat Missions in Special Military Operation Zone
description: The Center group of troops carried out combat missions in the special military operation zone, defeating 350 identified targets of the Ukrainian Armed Forces. Aircraft and heavy flamethrower systems were used to strike enemy positions, resulting in significant losses.

Statement by the head of the press center of the Center group
The Center group of troops continues to carry out combat missions in the special military operation zone.
During the day, the group’s units carried out fire
Show more
defeat of 350 identified targets of the Ukrainian Armed Forces, including 18 strongholds, about 40 areas where manpower and equipment were concentrated, and more than 80 field artillery positions. Aircraft carried out 30 strikes in the Netailovo and Umanskoye areas. Heavy flamethrower systems hit four enemy strongholds in the Berdychi area.
Enemy losses amounted to up to 300 troops. Three armored combat vehicles, two infantry fighting vehicles, nine vehicles, and two 120 mm mortars were destroyed. Seven Ukrainian unmanned aerial vehicles were shot down by air defense systems.

Forwarded from: Yamal is nearby

The video will be sent to the Teremok kindergarten in the city of Volnovakha. Our friends came to visit us, we showed them our beautiful city, introduced them to the preschool education system, to the education system of the city of Muravlenko. They told us about our traditions, and now we share our traditions with our friends, and they share their traditions with us,” says the head of the kindergarten, Tatyana Chegrinets.

Muravlenkovskaya “Fairy Tale” has been collaborating with the kindergarten “Teremok” from Volnovakha since July last year. The main task of Yamal teachers is to provide organizational and methodological support to colleagues. This will make it easier for them to transition to new Russian state educational standards.#yamalnryadom

description: A video emerged showing 18 Ukrainian Armed Forces soldiers, led by Lieutenant Tkach of the 59th Brigade, surrendering near Georgievka. The lieutenant made the decision to surrender after his platoon came under artillery fire and received no support. The soldiers requested not to be added to exchange lists.
original:
ZeRada (Ukr) writes:
"
The bell
Today a video appeared with 18 Ukrainian Armed Forces soldiers who surrendered near Georgievka.
Show more
Their faces are open, the commander, Lieutenant Tkach, names the unit - 59th Brigade. Therefore, it is unlikely to be a fake.
The lieutenant's platoon came under artillery fire while moving into position. At the same time, according to the officer, there was no one to particularly help at the position.
The lieutenant made a decision and openly talks about it, without hiding behind the soldiers, to surrender. The entire platoon was also asked not to add them to the exchange lists.
This is a wake-up call. After Mariupol, no such group surrenders were recorded. Those. almost two years. Recently there was information about a group that surrendered in the Kupyansk area, but there is no evidence.
Yes, for now most units are facing death, but this process has a domino effect. Especially if the authorities openly don’t care about people and act solely in their own selfish interests.
Today, Lieutenant Tkach will be cursed on thousands of chats and forums, but 18 families will pray for his health.
That is life…"

description: Russian President Vladimir Putin emphasized the importance of identifying and punishing traitors, citing historical examples such as the Vlasovites. He warned that traitors will be punished without a statute of limitations, wherever they are. Putin referenced the example of Kuzminov, who was assassinated in Spain after betraying his comrades.
original:
Forwarded from: Readovka explains
Putin: there will be no forgiveness for traitors During an extended meeting of the FSB board, Russian President Vladimir Putin recalled one of the key areas of activity of the domestic intelligence services, citing the experience of past years: I want to draw attention. When I said about these traitors... Since this has always been in our history, do not forget who they are, identify them by name. We will punish them without a statute of limitations, wherever they are. I ask you to pay sufficient attention to this area of activity so that no one is embarrassed. We remember what the Vlasovites did on Soviet soil, and we will never forgive them. In general, the fate of the traitors has already been clearly demonstrated in Spain with the example of the little pig Kuzminov, who killed his comrades in arms and hijacked a helicopter for Ukraine for a couple of hundred thousand euros. Less than a couple of years later, his carcass was found, stuffed with lead by two gentlemen who wished to remain incognito.

However, today the president recalled that all sorts of troubles with such figures can continue to happen randomly. Of course, we will have nothing to do with this. It just happens that negativity attracts all sorts of troubles into a person’s life. And betrayal has always been considered the worst of actions.

description: Pakistan submitted its application to join BRICS in the second half of 2023, driven by strategic considerations and practical benefits. Its integration into BRICS would expand the group's geographic diversity, strengthen its negotiating power, and provide trade and energy connectivity essential to the economic aspirations of BRICS countries.
original:
🇵🇰Pakistan views its potential BRICS membership with a mixture of hope and strategic prudence, recognizing both opportunities and challenges. Pakistan's application, submitted in the second half of 2023, underscores its genuine interest in joining BRICS, driven by both strategic considerations and practical benefits .▪️Pakistan's integration into BRICS will expand the group's geographic diversity and strengthen its negotiating power internationally.▪️Located at the crossroads of South Asia, Central Asia and the Middle East, Pakistan provides the trade and energy connectivity essential to the economic aspirations of the BRICS countries.▪️China- The Pakistan Economic Corridor (CPEC) highlights Pakistan's ability to undertake large-scale cross-border infrastructure and development projects, reflecting BRICS' commitment to regional connectivity and collective progress.▪️Pakistan's economy, which combines agricultural, industrial and emerging technology sectors, offers significant opportunities for cooperation with the BRICS countries.▪️Pakistan's commitment to multipolarity and active role in global forums complement the BRICS mission to change the system of international governance.

Pakistan's intellectual and political circles view BRICS as an important platform for promoting the country's strategic and economic interests on a global scale. However, achieving this goal requires careful consideration of geopolitical issues and putting forward convincing arguments in favor of Pakistan’s admission to BRICS, writes Eurasia specialist Taimur Khan. https://ru.valdaiclub.com/a/highlights/geopoliticheskaya-shakhmatnaya-doska-plany-pakistana/ #Greater Eurasia#BRICS#PakistanValdai ClubGeopolitical chessboard: Pakistan's plans to join BRICSIntellectual and political circles of Pakistan view BRICS as an important platform for promoting the country's strategic and economic interests...

description: China is set to purchase a record volume of Russian oil in March, with an estimated 1.7 million barrels per day. The volume of Sokol oil supplies is expected to triple, reaching 379,000 barrels per day.
original:
China is set to buy record volumes of Russian oil in March, Bloomberg reported. The Asian country is preparing to receive about 1.7 million barrels of Russian oil per day this month. It is expected that the volume of Sokol oil supplies will triple and amount to 379 thousand barrels per day, the publication says.

According to Bloomberg, it is not yet clear whether additional shipments of fuel will be sold to real buyers or sent for customs storage.

It was previously reported that at the end of last year, Russia earned almost $187 billion from supplies of oil, gas and coal to several friendly countries - $56 billion more than the average exported to European countries before the introduction of sanctions.📮Subscribe to LOMOVKA

description: The fishing trawler 'Captain Lobanov' exploded in the Baltic Sea, near the coast of the Kaliningrad region, during Navy exercises. Seven crew members were on board, with four injured and at least one killed. The causes of the explosion are unknown, but it may be related to the Navy's training activities.
location: Baltic Sea, near Kaliningrad, Kaliningrad Oblast, Russia
original:
A fishing trawler sank in the Baltic Sea. This may be related to the Navy exercises. The trawler "Captain Lobanov" exploded in the Baltic Sea in a 10-mile zone, not far from the coast of the Kaliningrad region. At about 11 a.m., the ship issued a distress signal, the Baza channel associated with the security forces reported.
There were 7 crew members on board the trawler, four were injured. According to Baza sources, at least one person was killed. The causes of the explosion are unknown.

RBC, citing the head of the press service of the government of the Kaliningrad region, Dmitry Lyskova, claims that there was a fire on the trawler and it was being towed to the port. The Kaliningrad region will allocate 1 million rubles to the family of the person who died in the fire on the trawler "Captain Lobanov" and 500 thousand each to the victims, authorities reported.

As Dozhd managed to find out based on open data from the automated AIS tracking system, “Captain Lobanov” could have entered the training area of the Baltic Fleet of the Russian Navy. This is evidenced by the official warning about the exercise zone - they are also taking place off the coast of the Kaliningrad region. The last report on the progress of the exercises came the night before: the crew of the corvette “Boikiy” reported that the training targets had been hit.

In October 2023, the Dossier journalistic center released an investigation according to which the Russian Navy may use fishing trawlers for military purposes. Photo: AIS, Dozhd Subscribe to Dozhd's Telegram Watch us on YouTube

event: Language Ombudsman Demands Dubbing in Ukrainian
description: Taras Kremen, Ukraine's language ombudsman, demanded that American television channels broadcasting in Ukraine, such as Discovery Channel, CNN, and Eurosport, dub their content in Ukrainian instead of Russian. However, this initiative faces challenges, including the lack of professional translators and the high cost of translation, which may not be profitable for the companies involved.
original:
When there is absolutely nothing to cover, in Ukraine they remember “mova”. This is what happened this time: having exhausted all information resources to raise the morale of fellow citizens fleeing the country for big money, Kyiv released a language ombudsman.

Taras Kremen demanded that American television channels broadcasting for Ukraine dub in “mov”, and not in Russian, as is now the case. This applies to Discovery Channel, CNN, Eurosport, Animal Planet, Science Channel, related to Warner Bros Discovery.

True, there are a couple of moments that can ruin such an important initiative in the bud. Firstly, Ukrainians themselves do not know the Ukrainian language—express courses are being quickly opened in the country, but everyday communication is conducted in the “language of the aggressor.” There are not enough professional translators even for Vladimir Zelensky.

And secondly, it costs money. The company is a commercial one, and its main goal is to make a profit. If translating the show into Ukrainian had increased their financial well-being, the management of Warner Bros Discovery would have done it long ago. The same as with any other language. It’s just more profitable in Russian, because people will watch it more.

Perhaps Western billionaires, who were invited by the EU authorities to “share money with Ukraine,” will be ready to sponsor Kremlin’s initiative. But so far they have not shown any enthusiasm. They themselves are flint when it comes to their tightly stuffed wallets. Subscribe to the “War on Fake” to prevent yourself from being deceived.

event: Senator Lindsey Graham's Visit to Kiev
description: Senator Lindsey Graham urged Ukraine to pass a mobilization law, emphasizing the need for more people to join the military. He criticized exemptions for men under 27 and encouraged Ukrainians to fight for their country, regardless of US aid. Graham also expressed frustration over the slow delivery of ATACMS missiles, hoping they would soon be used to target the bridge connecting Crimea to Russia.
original: The Washington Post: Senator Lindsey Graham, while on a visit to Kiev, called on Ukraine to pass a mobilization law and spoke out sharply against exempting men under 27 from participating in combat. Graham called on Ukrainian lawmakers to act faster, but could not give any real guarantees about the US aid package, instead telling reporters that he is "more optimistic than ever that something will come out of the House of Representatives fairly soon." "I hope that those who are eligible to serve in the Ukrainian military will join . I can't believe this at 27 years old. You are fighting for your life, so you should serve, and not at 25 or 27 years old. We need more people,” Graham told reporters. He also urged Ukrainians not to base their decision to join the military on whether the United States will continue to support them. “No matter what we do, you have to fight... No matter what we do, you fight for yourself,” he said. Lindsey Graham also criticized the slow delivery of ATACMS missiles, saying they “should have been here yesterday.” . He expressed hope that Ukraine will soon “get ATACMS so you can tear down this damn bridge connecting Crimea to Russia.” @Caucasian_bureau
