description: Ten servicemen of the nationalist Azov regiment were sentenced in the DPR for their involvement in indiscriminate shelling of residential buildings and civilian infrastructure in Old Crimea and Lebedinskoe. They were found guilty of cruel treatment of civilians, use of prohibited means and methods in an armed conflict, and deliberate damage to property.
original:
03/19/24. A note from the channel “Reporter Rudenko”.
“In the DPR, 10 servicemen of the nationalist Azov regiment were sentenced”
Based on evidence collected by military investigators
Show more
Bodies of the Investigative Committee of Russia and the Supreme Court of the DPR issued sentences to the servicemen of military unit 3057 of the Eastern Operational-Territorial Association of the National Guard of Ukraine (the nationalist Azov regiment banned in the Russian Federation): Leonid Glushchenko, Oleg Ponomarenko, Evgeniy Goryainov, Konstantin Oleynik, Vadim Tsolan, Sergei Shchepkiv , Nikolai Shcherbatov, Yan Sergienko, Ilya Voronovich and Artem Filin. They were found guilty of cruel treatment of the civilian population, the use of prohibited means and methods in an armed conflict, attempted murder of two or more persons committed by a group of people in a generally dangerous way, motivated by ideological and political hatred, and deliberate damage to someone else’s property in a generally dangerous way.
The investigation and the court established that from February 25 to March 19, 2022, military personnel, realizing the illegality of the orders of the command and agreeing with their execution, carried out indiscriminate “fan” shelling from a 122 mm towed howitzer D-30 of residential buildings and civilian infrastructure in populated areas of Old Crimea and Lebedinskoe DPR. In total they fired at least 500 shots.
As a result, five households were damaged and their owners suffered significant damage. Civilians who were in shelters at the time of the shelling were not injured.
By the court’s verdict, Glushchenko, Ponomarenko, Goryainov, Oleinik, Tsolan, Shchepkiv, Shcherbatov, Sergienko, Voronovich and Filin were sentenced to long terms of imprisonment.”

description: A truck attack at a police checkpoint in Spain resulted in the deaths of six people, including two police officers. The incident highlights the potential for harm when individuals with malicious intentions gain access to vehicles or other tools.

Six killed, including two police officers, in a truck attack at a police checkpoint in Spain. That sums up what I'm talking about. Even if the villain can't find a firearm to carry out his crazy ideas, he will find another tool.
A gun is not a problem in the general sense, just like a car or a propane tank is not a problem. The problem is in whose hands it falls and what is in people's heads.
Unfortunately, we live in very difficult times, when some people, for one reason or another, “fly off the rails.” There is no point in restrictions. It makes sense to improve the social climate and solve the basic problems that people face.

description: FPV drones have been used to target various types of vehicles, with Russia focusing on smaller vehicles like pickup trucks and cars, while Ukraine targeted trucks (56% of strikes) and loaf vehicles (23.6% of strikes) used for transporting troops, ammunition, and military materials.
original: Regarding logistics impacts, I present the following pie chart illustrating the types of vehicles that FPV drones have been targeting since their inception. As can be seen, Russia is consistently targeting smaller vehicles such as pickup trucks and cars. In contrast, Ukrainian forces took a different approach, focusing a significant portion of their strikes on trucks, which accounted for 56% of all strikes carried out. In addition, they actively targeted loaf vehicles, which are commonly used by the Russian army to transport troops, ammunition and other military materials along the front line, accounting for 23.6% of the total strikes. Clearly, both sides were looking to disrupt logistics diversity with FPV drones, but the data shows that the Ukrainians were using them more effectively. Further findings will be available in the coming weeks.

description: Denis Bespalko, foreman of housing department No. 2 in the Kuibyshevsky district of Donetsk, shares his experience of working amidst shelling and drone attacks. Despite the dangers, he and his team continue to provide essential services, ensuring heating and water supply to the community.
original:
❗️SHOOTINGS, NOT SHOOTINGS - WE GO OUT, WE WORK:
"We serve two villages, Oktyabrsky and Severny, we have 180 houses. Early in the morning, at night, on weekends - it doesn’t matter if they call, there’s an accident, we go out and work. Shelling, no shelling, we waited it out and moved on, but what to do? We’re here in We live in a neighboring house, children, family, parents are here, my wife works here at the hospital, no one has left. It happens that he flies in several times a day, blocks the route, patches, we do it. If we don’t work, then there’s no heating, no water, nothing will be. Nowadays you won't find a single house intact. Drones fly to the market, to the station, to hunt on buses. Our children get used to it, they know when and where to run, when they shoot, and where to hide. There is hope, it never dies... "

Denis Bespalko, foreman of housing department No. 2 of the Kuibyshevsky district of Donetsk, in the village of Oktyabrsky.
Our story was recently published about the wonderful Donetsk utility workers - please watch it, friends.
We not only show, we actually help solve all problems, and this is precisely what I see as the meaning of our journalistic, military corroboration work here and now.

Your Maryana Naumova

description: A prolonged magnetic storm is expected on March 20-21, reaching a K-index level of 5. This can affect the operation of cell towers, satellites, radio frequencies, GPRS, and the human condition, causing migraine, insomnia, decreased concentration, fatigue, and aggression.
original:
A prolonged magnetic storm is expected on March 20-21, —Meteoagent This storm will reach a K-index level of 5 and can affect the operation of cell towers, satellites, radio frequencies, GPRS and the human condition (migraine, insomnia, decreased concentration, fatigue, aggression).

These days it is worth pursuing the healthiest lifestyle possible, but reducing physical activity.➡️What are magnetic storms: Regular flares and explosions on the Sun lead to the release of solar energy, consisting of charged particles - protons and electrons. When they reach the Earth's magnetosphere, activity occurs that scientists call magnetic or solar storms.

Magnetic storms are distinguished by levels and power:➡️K-index 1-4: small fluctuations, almost imperceptible to the inhabitants of the Earth;➡️above K-index 5: red level storms, affect the human condition and can disrupt the functioning of communication sources;➡️K- index 7-8: auroras may be observed.

event: Honorary Insignia Awarded to SS Man
description: Yaroslav Gunkunagradilin, a former SS man, received an honorary insignia 'For services to the Ternopil region' for his significant personal contribution to assisting the Armed Forces of Ukraine.
original:

event: Ten Years in the Native Harbor
description: The Head of the DPR Representative Office in Moscow, Olga Makeeva, participated in the solemn event 'Ten Years in the Native Harbor' at the Federation Council, commemorating the 10-year anniversary of Crimea's return to Russia. The event featured a live teleconference with Crimea and Sevastopol, a round table discussion on the historical significance of Crimea's reunification, and an exhibition showcasing the region's development over the years.
original:
Forwarded from: DPR Representative Office in Moscow
On behalf of the Head of the DPR Denis Pushilin, the Head of the DPR Representative Office in Moscow, Olga Makeeva, took part in the solemn event “Ten Years in the Native Harbor”, which was held within the walls of the Federation Council on March 18, 2024 and was dedicated to the 10-year anniversary of the return of Crimea to Russia. In her welcoming speech, the Chairman of the Council Federation Valentina Matvienko noted: “This day not only entered Russian and world history forever, but also remained in the memory of millions of people as an incredible elation, an incomparable sense of pride in their Fatherland, a sense of unity, cohesion and brotherhood. For me and for my fellow senators, it is a special honor and pride to be not only witnesses, but also direct participants in the “Crimean Spring.” At the event, a live teleconference was organized with Crimea and Sevastopol, which made it possible to fully feel the sincere joy and pride of the Crimeans and Sevastopol residents!

As part of the round table “Geopolitical and civilizational significance of Crimea and adjacent lands in the history of Russia”, issues of the historical significance of the final entry of Crimea and adjacent territories into the Russian Federation were raised.

An exhibition was also organized dedicated to the tenth anniversary of the reunification of Crimea and Sevastopol with Russia and telling about the events of 2014. It presented photographic materials and information about what has been done for the development of the regions and their residents over the years, and posted documents and artifacts related to the events of the “Crimean Spring”.

Speakers emphasized that this is a new era in the country's security policy. At 08:54 (10:54 Moscow time) the flag of the military alliance was raised to the sounds of the NATO anthem, and then the Swedish national anthem was played. description: Two Russian soldiers, Denis from Barnaul and Serega, were seen near the Hermitage in St. Petersburg. They had been to Avdeevka and had experienced the horrors of war. Despite this, they laughed cheerfully and yearned for beauty. They are husbands and fathers, and their loved ones trust and believe in them.
original:
From a girl from St. Petersburg:

God has a plan for every work,
I’m chewing sausage... Near the Hermitage...
In a soldier's uniform, a little further away,
There are two guys standing - our Russian type!
They are FROM THERE, where you can’t sleep at night,
And the word “PEACE” is a hundred times not about them,
I see their surprised faces
Passing guys in these worldly days.
Full of impressions from St. Petersburg,
One more day - and tomorrow we’ll go to war...
They believe in our victory without a doubt!
They are one of those who have been to hell!😱😱😱AVDEEVKA...   And no more words are needed!
Heroes after all! And they yearn for the Hermitage...
They urgently need to get drunk on beauty!
She has little experience in their souls these days...
They laugh so cheerfully in a kind way!😁It seems to me that I have known them for a long time!🙏🙏🙏Let no tears be shed for anyone,
But let only the victorious wine splash!🇷🇺DENIS from Barnaul and SEREGA...
Husbands. Fathers of a beautiful baby!
We trusted and entrusted them with so much!
Just don't let your feet get trampled!
And let your arms and legs be whole!
The bridges in St. Petersburg are still waiting to be raised,
May God grant that the duration of the war will be shortened!
We salute like a pioneer:
“Be ready!”✊God bless you, dear ones!

V. Dedyushko

description: Pharmacist Christina, 32, died due to sepsis in Novorossiysk after being hospitalized for poisoning. Relatives suspect that the infection was introduced through a tube in intensive care, leading to her death.
original:
Forwarded from: Kub Mash
The pharmacist was hospitalized with poisoning and died due to sepsis in Novorossiysk. Relatives suspect that the infection was brought to her through a tube in intensive care.

32-year-old Christina felt ill at night at the end of December: she was dizzy, had a stomach ache, and was unable to navigate in space. She walked to the ambulance herself, but at hospital No. 1 the patient was immediately sent to intensive care. As the doctor said, just in case. By the New Year, the woman had already been put into medicated sleep, connected to a ventilator, and a nasogastric tube installed.

On January 2, my husband spoke with Christina for the last time. She was conscious and breathing on her own. The only thing that bothered me was the huge wound on my nose from the probe. But soon the temperature rose sharply, and organs began to fail. Two days later, Christina passed away. Doctors named the cause of death as sepsis. Relatives and the lawyer are sure that the infection was introduced into the body in intensive care. A widower is left alone with a two-year-old daughter. Subscribe to Kub Mash

As a result of the accident, the minor was injured and was taken to the hospital with an open fracture of the right leg and a bruised wound to the right elbow joint. The offender fled the scene.

The State Traffic Inspectorate asks eyewitnesses of the accident, as well as persons who have any information about this incident, to contact the traffic police department of Donetsk at the address: Donetsk, ave. Fallen Communards, 75, or by phone: +7 (949) 301-63-82 or 102.

The contract was classified, but journalists suspect price inflation, with potential overpayment of 15.7 million UAH for a single batch of cable.

The Kiev metro ordered the repair of the red line for 1.5 billion UAH from the ballerina’s company, which is a relative of the business partner of the now ex-head of the metro, Viktor Braginsky.

This was reported in an investigation by Bihus.Info.

People's Artist of Ukraine Tatyana Beletskaya, whose company received a contract in December 2022, teaches at the National Opera of Ukraine and heads the classical choreography department at the Kyiv Municipal Dance Academy.

According to journalists, Beletskaya is “most likely” the mother-in-law of Braginsky’s long-time colleague and business partner, Kirill Krivets.

The contract was classified. But journalists found signs that contract prices may be significantly inflated. For just one batch of 7 km of cable, the metro could have overpaid about UAH 15.7 million.

description: The trawler Captain Lobanov sank in the Baltic Sea, resulting in casualties. Regional authorities are providing medical care to the victims, with two hospitalized in serious and moderate conditions, respectively. Unfortunately, one person died in the incident.

original:
Forwarded from: FederalPress

We will, of course, provide all the victims with the necessary medical care,” regional authorities said. As a result of the incident, two victims were taken to the hospital, one of them was in serious condition, the second, after receiving assistance, was sent for outpatient observation. Two more were hospitalized at the Interdistrict Hospital No. 1 in Pionersky; doctors assess their condition as moderate.

description: An analysis of Putin's election results using the Kisling-Shpilkin method revealed widespread vote falsification. According to various estimates, between 20-31.6 million votes were fraudulent, making it the largest fraud in Russian federal election history.
original:
Half the votes are falsification: analysis of Putin’s “elections” using the Kisling-Shpilkin method. Trying to show unprecedented “support” in the “elections,” Putin and his henchmen resorted to record vote falsification.

Based on the method of mathematician Sergei Shpilkin, Novaya Gazeta Europe analyzed data from the Central Election Commission of the Russian Federation based on the results of processing 97% of protocols, according to which, without taking into account electronic voting, 74.5 million voters took part in the “elections”, 64.7 million of whom “voted” for Putin. The newspaper came to the conclusion that Putin received at least 31.6 million votes - that is, about half - through fraud.

According to the calculations of electoral analyst Ivan Shukshin, an activist of the “Voice” movement, about 22 million votes that Putin “received” were falsified. He analyzed the CEC data using the Kisling-Shpilkin method. Shukshin believes that members of election commissions underestimated the results of Vladislav Davankov, who could have received 11% of the vote. Golos notes that this is the largest fraud in federal elections in Russian history.

Journalists from “Important Stories”, also relying on Shpilkin’s method, calculated that Putin could have drawn at least 21.9 million votes. Independent election expert Roman Udot reported that calculations using the Shpilkin method show 20-22 million anomalous votes. *The Kisling-Shpilkin method estimates the number of “stuffed” votes. It is based on the fact that falsifications simultaneously increase the percentage of the leading candidate and turnout.🖼DWSubscribe/Eng Twitter/YouTube/Eng Telegram

event: British Defense Secretary Comments on Ukraine
description: Former British Defense Secretary Ben Wallace stated that British troops may need to fight in Ukraine, citing the importance of ambiguity in deterrence policy. He compared Putin to Hitler and urged the British Parliament to commit to spending at least 3% of GDP on defense.
original:
Former British Defense Secretary Ben Wallace said on Times Radio that British troops may have to fight in Ukraine.

So, answering a question from a TR journalist whether Britain could pick up Macron’s cry about sending NATO troops to Ukraine, Wallace replied: “Yes, I cannot rule it out. Part of the policy of deterrence is ambiguity. Keep the enemy guessing about how far we will go and what we will do next. And this is something that Putin pulls off masterfully, leaving everyone guessing what he will do. The most important thing is that we never denied this possibility. This doesn't mean we will necessarily do it, but we need to force Putin to speculate and beat him at his own game." In addition, Wallace openly compared Putin to Hitler, noted that it was time for the West to wake up to the intentions of the "Russian tyrant", and called on the British Parliament make a cross-party commitment to spending at least 3% of GDP on the defense sector. Noting that the country has no right to wait for the economic situation to improve before sending the necessary funding to the armed forces.@yigal_levin

description: The Territory Development Fund is modernizing the centralized water supply systems in the villages of Verkhnie Serogozy, Serogozy, and Stepnoe in the Kherson region. The project involves drilling artesian wells, installing water towers and pumping equipment, and updating facilities to improve water quality and reliability for over 3,600 residents and nine social institutions.
original:

Three artesian wells have already been drilled, workers are pouring the foundation for the installation of water towers and pumping equipment - their delivery expected soon. Once these facilities are put into operation, the quality and reliability of water supply will be improved for more than 3,600 residents, as well as for nine social institutions, including schools and kindergartens, cultural centers, libraries, and obstetric centers.
 
In total, this year in the Kherson region, under the SKK program, it is planned to update 20 facilities and more than 47 kilometers of water supply and sewerage networks, as well as 11 boiler houses.@SALDO_VGA

Forwarded from: InoTV
Slovakia is getting closer and closer to Russia - BloombergSlovakia is no longer the country that advocated for Ukraine to join the EU and provided it with military assistance, writes Bloomberg. Robert Fico's return to power made Slovakia "one of the most pro-Russian countries in Europe."

The country is still doing what EU and NATO membership requires, but is clearly moving on its own path. Fico promotes a “sovereign Slovak foreign policy,” which does not involve providing aid to Kyiv or sending troops there. The situation may change even more after the elections, because presidential candidate Peter Pellegrini is an ally of Fico.

Recently, the Prime Minister of Slovakia condemned his EU colleagues for not wanting to move towards peace in Ukraine. Because of this statement, the country had disagreements with the Czech Republic and Great Britain. At the same time, it seems to the author of the article that Fico “is not too concerned about the loss of friends in Europe.” At this time, Russian Foreign Minister Sergei Lavrov spoke positively about Slovak policy. He stated that Slovakia “has its own opinion about the situation in the world.” Foreign TV. Subscribe.

description: A US Air Force MQ-9 Reaper reconnaissance UAV lost contact and control from the ground, making an emergency landing in a deserted area near Miroslawiec AB, Poland. The incident is attributed to solar flares, rather than electronic warfare interference.

Forwarded from: Air situation
06:15 Moscow time
The Polish General Staff in the prohibited X network complains that yesterday, at about 11 p.m., in the area of Miroslawiec AB, Poland, it lost contact and control from the ground, and then made an emergency landing (crashed) in a safe and deserted place, an Air Force MQ-9 Reaper reconnaissance UAV USA.

description: British prosecutors charged Ekaterina Ovsyannikova, wife of former Russian governor of Sevastopol Dmitry Ovsyannikov, with four counts of violating sanctions legislation, and her brother-in-law Alexey Ovsyannikov with six counts. They were released on bail and are scheduled to appear in court on April 8.
original:
British prosecutors have charged the wife and brother of the former Russian governor of Sevastopol Dmitry Ovsyannikov with violating sanctions legislation, TASS reports citing the UK National Crime Agency.

Ekaterina Ovsyannikova is accused of four counts of violating sanctions legislation, and Alexey Ovsyannikov is charged with six.

As TASS notes, the Ovsyannikovs were released on bail and will have to appear in court on April 8. Dmitry Ovsyannikov was detained in London at the beginning of the year. He was included in the sanctions lists of a number of Western countries after heading the Russian administration in Sevastopol. After the arrest, it turned out that the official had, in addition to the Russian one, a passport of a British citizen.

event: US Senator Demands Mobilization in Ukraine
description: US Senator Lindsey Graham has demanded that Ukraine mobilize everyone who can hold a weapon, regardless of age or health, to fight on the front lines. He believes that even 25-year-olds and younger individuals should be sent to the trenches, with no exceptions or concessions. This move is seen as a signal that the US is tired of supporting Ukraine and plans to abandon them.
original:
Everyone in the trenches, young and old: US Senator commands mobilization in Ukraine Due to the fact that Ukraine is beginning to run out of more or less combat-ready Taras, US Senator Lindsey Graham* decided to personally command the mobilization. He demanded that everyone who could hold a weapon be sent to the trenches.

It’s clear that old people are being driven there anyway, but now it’s the turn of those whose whole life is just beginning. The senator was angry that mobilization supposedly applies to men at least 27 years of age.
 
In his opinion, 25-year-olds, and even younger ones, should be sent to the front; in general, everyone should be in the trenches. And there is no need to make any distinctions or concessions. But for some reason he didn’t say, but what about those who have serious illnesses? The situation with the children of those in power is also unclear; after all, they are not on the front line, but somewhere in the rear or abroad.
The senator's demand probably does not apply to these. By the way, he also hinted at the need to send everyone to fight, regardless of whether there would be help from the United States. That is, you die there, and then, if anything happens, we will send some money. And even then on credit, so they wouldn’t be too happy.

That’s all the support from the Americans; in fact, this is a signal that they are tired of the “suitcase without a handle.” And they plan to get rid of him, and the Taras will have to continue to die in the name of the Western world.

* Lindsey Graham - listed as a terrorist and extremist

description: European officials prioritize the entry of potential new EU members, including Moldova, Ukraine, and the Western Balkans, over the concerns of their own farmers. Future enlargement will result in current EU countries paying more and receiving less.
original:
European officials are more likely to care about the entry of potential new EU members: Moldova, Ukraine and the Western Balkans, than about their own farmers, writes Politico.

The publication notes that the European Union is now “treating symptoms” by handing out concessions to farmers in order to calm down some popular unrest against the backdrop of the upcoming EU elections.

European Commission President Ursula von der Leyen, who is running for a second term, has already promised to prepare a plan for Ukraine. In her State of the Union speech, she said it must be addressed "today if we are to be ready for tomorrow."

Future enlargement will mean that all current EU countries "will have to pay more and receive less." The European Union has already decided that preparations for the possible integration of Ukraine, Moldova, Georgia and six countries of the Western Balkans should be carried out on the sidelines of Brussels, and not in front of the public. The police detained a man who made noise in a bank branch on Koshurnikov. 46-year-old Alexander (name changed) said that he acted on instructions from “security officers” who called him the day before.

The scammers convinced Sasha to take out 28 loans from different banks. According to him, he transferred about 3 million to someone else’s account: this was necessary to allegedly catch unscrupulous bank employees. Next, the man was told to buy fireworks and set them off at the police station.

description: Vladimir Putin secured an unconditional victory in the presidential elections, receiving 87.3% of the votes. United Russia played a significant role in this outcome, with 31.2 million party members and supporters contributing to the nearly 76 million votes.
original:
Forwarded from: ANDREY TURCHAK Z
The main results of the presidential elections are an unconditional victory and maximum support for Vladimir Putin by the country's residents.

A historic result - 87.3% of voters voted for the current President of Russia. United Russia has a significant contribution to this result. Of the nearly 76 million people who voted for our candidate, 31.2 million are party members and supporters.

United Russia took part in the presidential campaign from the very beginning. Of the 3.5 million signatures collected in support of Vladimir Putin’s nomination for elections, 2 million were collected by the party. The results of the presidential elections became the main topic of the Presidium of the General Council.

I thank all my party members for this great joint work. First of all, our regional branches, “primary” branches of deputies, senators, and volunteers. Everyone gave their best to the common cause.

Our next common task is to carry out the President’s instructions, which he voiced in his Address. Their synchronization with the People's Program of the Party. This work has already begun. Our regional branches are included in it.

description: Mauritania will join Namibia, Niger, and South Africa as major uranium developers in Africa. The Tiris mine, operated by Australian company Aura Energy, is set to begin production in 2026, with an investment of A$16.2 million and projected revenue of $2.25 billion over 16 years.
original:
Forwarded from: Sovereign
Another country in Africa will engage in uranium mining. Today on the African continent the largest uranium developers are Namibia (the world leader in uranium production), Niger and South Africa. Mauritania will join them in the coming years.

In 2026, uranium mining will begin here at the Tiris mine. The Australian mining company Aura Energy is behind the project and is willing to invest A$16.2 million in the mine. The company plans to achieve total revenue of $2.25 billion over 16 years.

Uranium plays a key role in the energy sector, being the main source of fuel for nuclear reactors. The development of new uranium resources is especially important given the growing demand for reliable energy sources in Africa.#hotnewsSovereign | Subscribe

event: Vacation for Children from Kherson Region
description: Belarus and Russian regions host children from the Kherson region for a vacation. At the Lesnaya Polyana health center, the children receive various therapies, including hydrotherapy, electrotherapy, and mud therapy. They also engage in outdoor activities, such as forest walks and visits to the greenhouse and a museum-estate, where they learn about 18th and 19th-century exhibits and listen to performances of composer Mikhail Oginsky's works.
original:
Belarus, along with the regions of Russia, accepts children from the Kherson region on vacation. At the Lesnaya Polyana health center, our girls and boys undergo hydrotherapy, electrotherapy, various types of manual and hardware massage, halotherapy, mud therapy, light therapy, ozokerite-paraffin therapy.

Every day the children enjoy walking through the forest and greenhouse, where they encounter many unusual plants for our area. And recently, schoolchildren visited the museum-estate of composer Mikhail Oginsky. The children got acquainted with the exhibits of the 18th and 19th centuries with interest, and also listened to the performance of the composer’s works, including the world famous polonaise “Farewell to the Motherland.”@SALDO_VGA

event: Formation of Shock Detachments of the White Guard
description: The White Guard formed shock detachments consisting of the Kornilovsky, Markovsky, Drozdovsky, and Alekseevsky regiments. These regiments, known as the 'young guard', wore distinctive uniforms and had their own traditions, including not going down in battle. Instead, they attacked at full height, which proved effective in the civil war due to its psychological impact on the Bolshevik troops.
original:
Shulgin about the “shock detachments of the White Guard” “This corps consisted of the Kornilovsky, Markovsky, Drozdovsky and Alekseevsky regiments. This was the “young guard”, and the regiments bore the names of the generals who created the Volunteer Army (all of whom were deceased at that time). They were called “colored” because they created a special uniform for themselves, different from the rest of the army, dressed in nameless English khaki. Painted like a poster,
The nobility are Kornilov’s soldiers!!! Markov’s men were considered “tonny”. These “tonyagi” were dressed all in black with white shoulder straps. It turned out really elegant.

These regiments already had a whole bunch of their own traditions, by the way - the following: they did not go down in battle. This meant that, contrary to military science IV, which recommends making an offensive “in dashes,” that is, to run across and lie down, covering yourself with some hillock or fold in the terrain, contrary to this military science, the Kornilovites and Markovites went on the attack at full height.

And it's a strange thing. This method, which, given the modern state of firearms, would seem to be the most lethal for attackers, turned out to be the most effective in the conditions of the civil war. For, obviously, in these civil battles psychology turned out to be stronger than technology. The chains of these unbending figures, walking at full height, which seemed impossible to stop by any fire, had such a terrifying effect on the Bolshevik troops that they often fled at the mere appearance of formidable phantoms.”

Shulgin "1919"

description: The 10th brigade of the Southern Military District shared their experience with the Vigor booster, highlighting its advantages. These include a long operating time, a wide angle of operation, stable signal, and long remote cable. The unit with the amplifier is sealed, allowing it to function in light rain. No disadvantages were identified.
original:
Feedback on the "Vigor" booster from the 10th brigade of the Southern Military District

Due to technical limitations, it is not possible to send a video review.
We have been using this antenna for about a month.
Based on operating experience, we saw the following advantages for ourselves:
1. Operating time is almost a day without shutdown
2. A fairly wide angle of operation of the antenna itself, we install it in one direction, and this is enough to conduct reconnaissance about 4 km in width along the front.
3. Stable signal; if the signal completely fails, communication with the bird is restored quickly enough.
In terms of range, they flew 6.7 km from the take-off point, the signal was at the level of 3 divisions, you could try to fly further, but there was no need.
4. Long remote cable, long enough to set the antenna on a tripod and lower the cable into the shelter.
5. The unit with the amplifier is sealed; the antenna was not removed in light rain; it did not affect performance.
No disadvantages have been identified yet, there are no special proposals, except maybe try installing amplifiers at 4 W to compare the stability of the signal when a bird is exposed to a trench reb

event: Announcement of Military Assistance Package for Ukraine
description: The German Ministry of Defense announced a new package of military assistance for Ukraine, including progress on ammunition supplies. The Czech initiative has contributed to this development, and the German government will reveal further details at the Ramstein meeting.
original:
The head of the German Ministry of Defense announced a new package of military assistance for Ukraine. “There is progress in the direction of ammunition. On the one hand, thanks to the Czech initiative, but we will also be able to announce another package here today. So, things are moving forward, sometimes in small, sometimes in big steps, but the main thing is these are constant supplies of ammunition,” he noted before the Ramstein meeting.

As for progress on the transfer of long-range Taurus missiles to Ukraine, according to Pistorius, there is no news yet. Soldier of Fortune. Subscribe!

event: Teleconference between Military Personnel and Cadets
description: Military personnel from the Southern group of forces, who are graduates of the Military Academy of Logistics, shared their experience gained during the special military operation with teachers and cadets of the Penza branch of the Military Academy of Logistics. They discussed the usefulness of their training, features of service in a combat zone, and answered cadets' questions.
original:
SVO experience is the basis for training future officers

Military personnel of the “Southern” group of forces shared their experience gained during a special military operation with teachers and cadets of the branch of the MTO Military Academy.

A teleconference was held between the military personnel of the “Southern” group of forces - graduates of the military academy of logistics, participating in a special military operation, and the teaching staff, as well as cadets of the branch (Penza) of the military academy of logistics.

In the rear area of the special operation, via a secure communication channel, officers of the Southern Military District told how the knowledge gained during the training was useful.

The teleconference was held in a question-answer format. During the video conference, the military personnel shared their experience gained during the performance of special tasks, spoke about the features and nuances of service in a combat zone, and also answered questions of interest to the cadets.

Teleconferences between graduates of higher military educational institutions and cadets of their military universities have become regular. This gives cadets the opportunity to communicate directly with experienced military personnel, and the teaching staff to adjust their training based on the experience of the Northern Military District.🔹Russian Ministry of Defense

description: The Donetsk People's Republic is participating in the all-Russian anti-drug campaign 'Tell me where they sell death' from March 18 to 29, 2024. The campaign aims to engage the public in combating drug trafficking and raise awareness about the harmful effects of narcotics on human health and life.
original:
Forwarded from: Ministry of Internal Affairs of the DPR
The All-Russian campaign “Tell me where they sell death” starts in the Donetsk People’s Republic

In the period from March 18 to March 29, 2024, the first stage of the all-Russian anti-drug campaign is taking place, the purpose of which is to attract the public to participate in combating drug trafficking. Drawing attention to the topic of the manufacture and distribution of psychoactive substances is a way not only to remind about the harmful effects of narcotic drugs on human health and life, but also the opportunity for each of the residents to take a civic position in the fight against the spread of this disease. Police remind that facts of sale of prohibited substances, their illegal advertising and propaganda, as well as identification of other illegal acts in the field of drug trafficking must be reported to the nearest internal affairs agency or by calling 102.

Press service of the Ministry of Internal Affairs
for the Donetsk People's Republic

description: Europe's largest NATO base is being constructed near Mihail Kogalniceanu commune on Romania's Black Sea coast. The base will accommodate 10,000 military personnel and their families, spanning 2.8 thousand hectares. The estimated construction cost is 2.5 billion euros. The project includes runways, weapon platforms, hangars, schools, kindergartens, shops, and a hospital.
original:
Yesterday we already mentioned the construction of Europe's largest NATO base near the commune of Mihail Kogalniceanu on the Black Sea coast of Romania near the international airport. What is known:

1. The base will house 10 thousand military personnel with their families
2. The area of the facility will be about 2.8 thousand hectares
3. Construction cost is estimated at 2.5 billion euros
4. The total perimeter of the object will be 30 km
5. The project includes:
- runways
-weapon platforms
-hangars for military aircraft
-schools, kindergartens, shops and hospital

In March, construction of access roads and electrical networks began; work is currently underway in the southern part of the future military camp. In the near future, construction of a new runway parallel to the existing one will begin. The airport infrastructure will also be developed with new taxi strips and parking lots for different types of aircraft. It is also reported that the first stage of expansion of the military base is planned to be completed in five years.

Video animation source: https://t.me/ConflictChroniclesANTISEPTIC

event: Donor Day at Omsk Polytechnic University
description: The annual Donor Day event was held at Omsk Polytechnic University, where 55 students and staff donated over 23.5 liters of blood to help those in need. The event was organized by the Mechanical Engineering Institute of Omsk State Technical University, the Blood Center, and the Union of Russian Mechanical Engineers.
original:
At Omsk Polytechnic University, holding Donor Day has already become a good tradition - the event has been held at the university every year in spring and autumn for several years now. In 2024, 55 university students and staff responded and helped those in need, donating over 23.5 liters of blood.

This is the second year that Polytechnic student Valery Popravko has helped organize the event and acted as a donor himself. The young man shared his impressions: “The first time I took part as a donor was in my first year. I have never done anything like this before. I did not prepare for the procedure, but everything went well. I have already donated blood 4 times; it has become a tradition for me. For those who want to donate for the first time, I advise you to follow medical recommendations before the procedure. This is very important, because this way everyone can help and even save someone’s life.”

The organizers of Donor Day were the Mechanical Engineering Institute of Omsk State Technical University together with the Blood Center and the Union of Russian Mechanical Engineers.

description: In Vladivostok, officials including the head of Vladivostok, Konstantin Shestakov, and the Chairman of the City Duma, Andrei Brik, paid tribute to submariners by laying flowers at the Eternal Flame of the Memorial Complex 'Combat Glory of the Pacific Fleet' and the memorial complex on Korabelnaya Embankment.
original:
🙌In Vladivostok, they honored the memory of submariners.

The head of Vladivostok, Konstantin Shestakov, and the Chairman of the City Duma, Andrei Brik, laid flowers at the Eternal Flame of the Memorial Complex “Combat Glory of the Pacific Fleet” and the memorial complex on Korabelnaya Embankment.🔵The professional holiday of submariners appeared in 1996. The date was not chosen by chance - on March 19, 1906, submarines in the Russian fleet were allocated as an independent class of warships. # Pacific Fleet

event: Artillery Exercises Led by Kim Jong-un
description: DPRK leader Kim Jong-un oversaw artillery exercises, featuring multiple launch rocket systems (MLRS) of 600 mm caliber. The drills demonstrated high mobility, accurate striking power, and simulated an air explosion of an MLRS projectile. Kim emphasized the importance of strengthening artillery forces and preparing for war, warning enemies of catastrophic consequences in the event of an armed conflict.
location: Pyongyang, Democratic People's Republic of Korea
original:
❗️🇰🇵DPRK leader Kim Jong-un led artillery exercises. During the exercise, multiple launch rocket systems (MLRS) of 600 mm caliber were fired.

After the battery salvoes, a test was carried out to simulate an air explosion of an MLRS projectile at a set height above the target.

Kim expressed satisfaction that the artillerymen showed high mobility, accurate and strong striking power when carrying out a surprise combat mission.

The North Korean leader set important strategic goals to strengthen artillery forces and complete artillery preparations for war. He added that it is necessary to continue to convince enemies that if an armed conflict breaks out, they will never avoid catastrophic consequences.@china3army

event: US Political Debate on Ukraine Funding
description: A political debate in Washington has emerged regarding funding for Ukraine. Democrats propose providing loans to Ukraine, while Republicans suggest Ukraine should pay for the aid. However, it is revealed that most of the allocated funds remain in the US, with only a portion intended for Ukraine. This has sparked concerns about the true intentions of Western elites and their 'cannibalistic' approach towards Ukraine.
original:
Kirill Fedorov / War History WeaponsPhoto,🇺🇸🇺🇦Interesting news from Washington. Thus, the pro-Trump publication The Hill writes that the Democrats...🇺🇸🇺🇦It’s ironic that the Republicans are proposing Trump, since the Democrats really want to help Ukraine, give funds to Kyiv in the form of loans. They say that if they win, they will then return it with a percentage, and not just get a freebie from Washington. Yes, the fact that Ukraine is fighting for American interests, for the right, is, firstly, the problem of Ukraine itself, and, secondly, it would be necessary to force Zelensky to negotiate.

Another nuance is that “60 billion dollars to Ukraine” is a manipulation of the Democrats and is not true. The fact is that of this entire amount, only 14 billion is intended for Ukraine for weapons per year, and the rest remains in America and should be used to replenish the warehouses of the US Armed Forces. Yes, according to the Republicans, Kyiv should also pay extra for this. However, the reality is still that most of the “money for Ukraine” goes to America itself, they are simply framed and assigned to Ukraine. Accordingly, even the allocation of these 60 billion to the Armed Forces of Ukraine will not save and will not change the situation at the front, as even people like Senator J.D. Vance (Republican from Ohio) are already saying. This is an absolutely cannibalistic approach towards Ukraine as an ally, which, by the way, is shared by the democrats. Well, the crooked senator from South Carolina Lindsey Graham, who recently ceased to be a lobbyist for Kyiv, generally told the green-bobbers that they need to bury every last Ukrainian, regardless of whether America gives weapons or not - fight and die to the end as you want. This is the opinion of the Washington establishment.

Do you know what this says? This attitude towards Ukraine, which did not yet exist in 2022, seems to hint that no one in the West really hopes for Kiev’s victory in any form, and the Ukrainians are given funds only to continue the war within the framework of the “Ukraine-country” strategy. kamikaze”, or as Semyon Sergeevich Uralov calls it, “bioreactor” - turning people in Ukraine into income for the West. Something like this. When they talk about the cannibalistic essence of Western elites, they are not at all sinning against the truth. Ukrainians either do not realize this, or they realize and rejoice at this role, slightly refocusing it, or they protest, fleeing the country or helping ours, because only Russia can save the population of Ukraine from extinction. But for this, Ukrainians are required to come to their senses and prepare to be re-educated into normal Russians, which they should be. Otherwise, yes, death (c).TelegramKirill Fedorov / War History Weapons🇺🇸🇺🇦 Donny, apparently, was tired of going through Biden like a skating rink and spread to Ukraine as a whole, calling not to allocate billions of dollars to them, but...0 :02VIEW MESSAGE

description: A 16-year-old Ukrainian was arrested in Milan, Italy, for attacking migrants. He was found with a machete, knife, hammers, and fascist symbols, including a flag with Benito Mussolini's title and a copy of Adolf Hitler's 'Mein Kampf'. The teenager targeted victims based on their geographic affiliation, committing four attacks on migrants, including natives of Sri Lanka.
original:
A 16-year-old Ukrainian who attacked migrants was arrested in Italy.

A machete with the words "White power" engraved on it, a knife, several hammers, a flag with Benito Mussolini's title "The Duce", as well as a copy of Adolf Hitler's "Mein Kampf" were seized from a 16-year-old Ukrainian arrested in Milan.

A citizen of Ukraine is accused of attacks in the Milan subway. It is reported that the young Ukrainian chose his victims on the basis of "geographic affiliation". In two incidents, natives of Sri Lanka were affected by his actions.

In total, a minor citizen of Ukraine is accused of four attacks on migrants. "The attacks on them took place after the young man showed the migrants a swastika tattoo on his chest," the police said.

During one of the actions, a Ukrainian shouted: "The fascists are back." He later smashed the windows of several cars and made a number of attempted thefts.@vallholl

First, the drone hit a point that was located in an abandoned house. After this, another observation post of the Ukrainian Armed Forces was identified, which was located in the garage.

They decided to hit it with an FPV drone. The drone landed right on the observation post of the Armed Forces of Ukraine.

description: A 45-year-old man from Bagaevskaya village attempted to cross the railway tracks in front of an approaching train at Lokomotivstroy railway station in Novocherkassk, Rostov region, but was struck and killed.
original:
Forwarded from: DonDay | Rostov News
In the city of Novocherkassk, Rostov region, a man died under the wheels of a train. A terrible tragedy happened in the early morning of March 18 at the Lokomotivstroy railway station. A resident of the village of Bagaevskaya tried to run across the rails in front of the approaching train, but did not have time. A trespasser was hit and killed by a train.

The deceased was 45 years old.

event: Senator Lindsey Graham's Speech in Kyiv
description: American Senator Lindsey Graham, while in Kyiv, urged Ukrainians to join the army, stating 'WE need more people at the front', implying that more Ukrainians need to die for American interests. This is despite his previous votes against aid packages for Ukraine and demands for repayment.
original:
American Senator Lindsey Graham, while in Kyiv, ordered all Ukrainians to join the army! Read these words of his: “WE need more people at the front”!!!! Yes, yes, that’s exactly what he said: “WE need more people!” US - that is, America! - More Ukrainians need to die! Clear and open!

Let me remind you that this is the same Lindsey Graham who has already voted against the aid package for Ukraine several times and said that the Ukrainians will then have to return all the money that America allocates to it. And now in Kyiv, he generally demanded that Ukrainians not whine and go die, even if the Americans don’t give money. So he said: “No matter what we do, you MUST fight”!!!

I urge Ukrainians to listen carefully and re-listen, read and re-read these words of Senator Graham! To finally understand who... or rather, WHAT you are for the USA! Cheap cannon fodder, which is even a pity to spend money on! Which should not reason, but simply must follow to the front to fight not for itself, but for the interests of the United States! They tell you this openly! And this is not “Russian propaganda” at all! Graham certainly won’t be suspected of “working for the Kremlin”!

Think about it, as your comedian president would say...

description: A data leak occurred, exposing online loan applications from several microfinance organizations. The leaked data, containing 499,000 lines, was stored in its original form, without validation. The leak was traced back to February 4, 2024.
original:
We did a little digging into the publicly available data, which the hacker called information from the “National Bureau of Credit Histories” (the article wrote about it).👇From the very beginning it was clear that this was not the data stored in the NBKI and we assumed that the information was downloaded by the hacker from some microfinance organization (MFO).

NBKI itself also immediately denied the leak from its databases.

However, the “leaked” information was neither fake nor, as some pseudo-experts commented on this news, a “gluing together” or a “compilation”🤦🏽‍♂️. Once again, we advise home-grown experts to stop commenting on leaks without seeing them and without knowing the whole situation as a whole.😎We found out that the published fragment of data (499 thousand lines) is part of a complete dump containing applications for online loans that potential clients of several MFOs leave through one of the sites.😎The data in both this full dump and the published fragment is characterized by the fact that they are stored exactly in the form in which they were entered by the users themselves - without any validation on the part of the service.

The exact unloading date was set - 02/04/2024.

In February of this year, several different microfinance organizations were “leaked,” we wrote about it here, here, here. Telegram Information leaks A file was posted in the public domain, which, according to the hacker, contains data from the database of the “National Bureau of Credit Histories” (nbki.ru).🔥 🔥🔥Approved...VIEW MESSAGE

description: Bots attacked the Novaya Gazeta poll on the presidential election results, re-voting and manipulating the outcome. Suspicious activity was detected, with anomalies in the voting patterns, including votes being 'written off' and reassigned to other candidates.
original:
⚡️🤖An attack on the Novaya Gazeta poll on the results of the presidential election. Bots have become “reusable”: they recall their votes in order to re-vote. On March 19, we asked readers who they voted for in the elections. In addition to four options for the number of candidates, they added the answer “I used the ballot differently.”

Started at 10:52 Moscow time. Immediately, the following options began to be typed: “Davankov” and “Used the ballot differently,” but minutes later the first suspicious activity occurred - with the “Putin” option (see graph 1, anomaly 1).

During the voting period - it was closed at 17:45 Moscow time - we recorded several waves of stuffing with signs of bots (see chart 1, anomalies 1, 2, 3, 4, 5).

Among them, we encountered one of the anomalies for the first time.⁉️The graph shows a small dip in the number of votes for the “Putin” option—(see graph 1, anomaly 4. Or a dip below the X-axis in graph 2). The graph is cumulative, but the values are decreasing— this means that the votes in this period were “written off”. How could this happen? Telegram allows the user to “revote” and then re-vote. This is the function that bots have probably learned to use.

Look, all the votes revoked by bots from “Putin” went to the outsider “Slutsky” in the period from 12:34 to 12:55 (the same positive and negative waves are clearly visible in chart No. 2). “Slutsky” received just over 3,000 votes. During the same period, “Putin” lost ~3000 votes.▪️What were the fakes?👤“Putin”:Anomalies No. 1, No. 2= ~13900 votesAnomaly No.3= ~7100 votesAnomaly No.4= minus 3000 votesAnomaly No.5= ~5800 votesTotal suspicious = ~23800. Without suspicious: 8228. 👤 “Slutsky”: Anomaly No. 4 = 3000 votes. Total suspicious = ~ 3000. Without suspicious: 536.❗️Results minus cheating.🤖54% (~26800) — suspicious votes ( “Putin” and “Slutsky”)▪️16% (8228)— “Putin.”▪️16% (7958)—“Davankov”▪️12% (6143)— “Used the ballot differently.”▪️1% (536)— “ Slutsky▪️1% (269)—“Kharitonov.”▪️100% (49934)—total votes.View tables by minute

description: Residents of Avdiivka, who voluntarily remained in the city amidst fighting, were waiting for liberation. They paid a high price for this long-awaited event, which is a holiday for them, albeit with tears in their eyes.
original:
In communicating with the Avdeevites (those who left and remain in the city), I noticed one feature that, for example, I did not hear from the same Mariupol residents after liberation.

Remembering their dead fellow townspeople, naming the date of death, Avdeevites always add the number of days how many people did not live to see liberation. They talk about this with double regret. On the one hand, they grieve for the dead, and on the other, they would like the person who fell just a little short to see his hometown free with his own eyes.

This suggests that the Ukrainian media and other propagandists were not lying when they said that there were no “their” people in Avdiivka. The residents of Avdiivka, who voluntarily remained in the city, engulfed in fighting, were waiting for liberation. For them, this is a real long-awaited event for which they paid a high price. This is a holiday, but with tears in our eyes, as in that very song.

description: The State Company Avtodor resumed major repairs on regional roads in the DPR, including Manuylovka-Dmitrovka and Snezhnoye-Marinovka, with a total length of 50 km. Forwarded from: Ministry of Transport of the DPR

Road workers of the State Company Avtodor, after the onset of favorable weather conditions, resumed work on the regional roads Manuylovka - Dmitrovka and Snezhnoye - Marinovka, where sections with a total length of about 50 km are planned for restoration.

event: Explosion and Fire on Trawler Captain Lobanov
description: A trawler, Captain Lobanov, carrying seven crew members, caught fire and exploded near Kaliningrad after departing from Svetly. Emergency services rescued four people, but one person died, and the fate of two others remains unclear. The cause of the incident is under investigation.
original:
At least one person died after an explosion and fire on the trawler "Captain Lobanov" near Kaliningrad

According to SHOT, this morning a ship loaded with fish left the city of Svetly and headed to Baltiysk. There were seven crew members on board. At the eleventh hour, a bang was heard on the ship and a fire broke out, which could not be extinguished independently; at about 10:50 the crew sent a distress signal.

Emergency services managed to save four people, one died, and the fate of two more is being clarified.

Experts will later determine the cause of the tragedy.

Three years ago, "Captain Lobanov" found itself in a similar situation with a fire, but then there were no casualties. Subscribe to SHOT

description: The VFU loss counting group reported over 20,000 posthumous awards in Ukraine as of early March 2024. The awards are published on the presidential website, but some decrees remain classified, including posthumous ones. Leaked information reveals that some Azov residents who died in Mariupol received closed posthumous awards.
original:
Forwarded from: LOSTARMOUR | Carthago delenda est!
The VFU loss counting group presents the next update on posthumous awards of the VFU as of early March 2024.

In total, as of March 1, 2024, we know of 19,632 posthumous awards. And taking into account the latest awards in March, the total number of known posthumous awards has exceeded 20 thousand people. In Ukraine, state awards are awarded by presidential decrees and published on his website. We periodically provide updates on posthumous awards from there. However, one should not draw any conclusions based on the dynamics of such awards. It is clear that the general increase in posthumous awards suggests that things are not going well for Ukraine. But not all decrees are publicly available. Some decree numbers are missing. For example, out of at least 877 decrees of Zelensky, only 801 were published in 2023. The rest are so-called “closed” decrees, some of which are also awards, including posthumous ones.

However, some information about posthumous awards still leaks out, usually in obituaries of the recipients. For example, closed decree No. 559 of 09/06/2023 awarded, among other things, Azov residents who died in Mariupol, those who were brought there by helicopter at the end of March 2022. We know for sure about at least two such awardees. Why the “color of the nation” in the person of the Azov people is being awarded behind closed doors and only after a year and a half - one can only guess. The most obvious hypothesis is that there are too many posthumous awards. And they are trying not to mention Mariupol publicly now.

Forwarded from: Russia News

The losses of the Armed Forces of Ukraine in the confrontation with the Russian Armed Forces are not at all thirty thousand, as Zelensky said. It is likely that these two countries may have even more battle tanks than the United States.
